Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Steven W
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in the Omni Royal Crescent in New Orleans from April 7-11, 2012. This was the perfect hotel, and I can't recommend it strongly enough. The price was very reasonable -- obviously there are tons of great hotels in the area, but for the price this one can't be beat. Location is two blocks off Canal Street, and threfore two blocks from the French Quarter. It was a very short walk, totally safe at night, etc. It is also close to the Harrahs casino, which was a plus. The staff was EXCELLENT. In particular I want to name Sarah, who worked at the front desk, as being extremely helpful. I hope they know that she is a superstar and put her on a manager track -- otherwise they will lose her to the Ritz or one of the other top hotels around. But she was teriffic - helpful as can be at every opportunity. But honestly, that applied to the entire staff, the managers, etc. Everyone was teriffic there. The rooms were nice and spaceous. I had a jacuzzi suite, which cost the same as a standard room at the Marriott just two blocks away. It was well worth it. My one complaint was that I didn't love the bed, but it wasn't awful or anything -- just not my own bed that I love. As a comparison, the first two nights of my trip (April 5-6) we stayed at the Iberville Suites, which is a sister-hotel to the Ritz Carlton. I would recommend the Omni Royal Crescent over the Iberville Suites in a heartbeat. Thanks to Sarah and the rest of the staff at the Omni Royal Crescent for a fantastic experience. It's a great hotel, and I'll stay there again next time I'm back in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missbeckah83
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and absolutely love this hotel. It's across from the French Quarter, so it's not noisy whatsoever, yet still close enough for a short walk to all the action. Very clean hotel, the staff are amazing, and the bathroom is incredible. If you want peace and quiet, this is the place for you! There is a restaurant attached to the hotel and it's delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Omni Black-level Frustration”
Reviews.Author: Alexjrosen
Reviews.Content: It was probably seven years ago when I stayed at this hotel last; I remembered it having a quaint, boutique quality which it still has. My first complaint, though, is the failure of this hotel with regard to me being a black-level Omni guest. Black is the highest level with Omni hotels and one of the benefits to being black-level is the complimentary double-upgrade provided. Essentially, this should guarantee getting a suite at the time of check-in. While I just recently stayed at the hotel, I have made reservations several times in the last couple months only to be told that "no suites were available". If I can book a suite online, there is a suite available - the hotel, however, seems to have a policy of stating they are all booked to avoid giving the upgrade. So of course when I went to check in this time there were no suites available. I know the above may sound snobby, but I travel extensively all year and whether it is airlines, hotels or rental cars, I have one or two brands with whom I deal exclusively due to the perks associated with my membership. I find it very frustrating when hotels choose to deny those benefits - it makes one question why one is loyal to that brand. Moreover, I was given a room on the second floor without even a window. I simply find it hard to believe there were no suites available on a Wednesday night. Otherwise, the hotel is a great location - on a nice, quiet street just a block off of Canal. The casino is a few blocks away, as is the French Quarter, the Superdome, etc. The decor of the hotel was classic and well-done - certainly had a nice luxury feel to it. The gym was lacking for anyone who takes working out seriously. If going to the gym involves a treadmill or elliptical machine for you, then you are fine. If you like lifting weights and really "working out", don't plan on using the hotel's gym. I found the hotel staff to be professional and polite and the service overall was excellent. My review of this hotel would have been 100% favorable if I were not at the highest level of their loyalty program but in a standard room without any windows.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Alternative to Big Conference Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Sunster1
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here instead of the Sheraton where my conference was because they offered a government rate within my per diem. What a great choice I made. It was very relaxing to return to low stress and quiet, personal atmosphere at the Omni each evening, after enduring crowds and chaos all day at the Sheraton. I stayed in a King room (250 sq ft) with plenty of space and a large well appointed bathroom with a whirlpool tub. It was very clean and comfortable with many pleasant touches (bathrobes, nice amenities, good coffee, and unobtrusive evening service) The front desk staff and bartender made me feel so welcome - remembering my name all week and responding to every request I had. I will stay here every year for this meeting and encourage others to defect from the huge hotels. The only thing I did not love about the room, was the lack of a window made me feel a little closed up, but I had requested a quiet room so that's probably why I was placed in an interior room. If you join their reward program, the web access is free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: The Onmi Crescent Hotel is a nice boutique hotel located near everything important in D/T New Orleans. I've stayed here a couple times and feel always the same. Easy walk to French Quarter, casino and all the attractions near by. Only down side is the rooms and bathrooms are a bit small but very nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.”
Reviews.Author: daviddouglassmith
Reviews.Content: When I arrived for a nine night stay, I was alarmed that I was having an allergic reaction to something when I walked in the room. The staff promptly offered me a choice of two other rooms, but I had to take the one with the desk, since I had brought my laptop to take advantage of the free WiFi. The new room was large and comfortable with three nice windows. Then I found out the WiFi doesn't work in room 501. The staff is very friendly and helpful about some things, but they insisted I call an 800 number to fix the WiFi. I balked at first, but eventually, against my better judgement, I made the call. 31 minutes of answering technical questions (while I'm on vacation) yielded a decision to move me to level 2. You get the idea. Forget the WiFi. It still upsets that they are comfortable making a fraudulent claim about offering WiFi, but life is short and I just repacked my laptop. I still like the place. Great location. Just don't bring your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Omni Royal Crescent”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedBadgerFan
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at the Omni Royal Crescent was good. The hotel is in a convenient location - close to downtown, Canal Street, the French Quarter - we walked everywhere. Arrival and parking were easy. The woman that checked us in gave us a map and pointed out good things for us to try while we were in town. The room was nice and clean - great floor to ceiling windows (room 801). We joined Omni's membership program, so wireless was included. We also got a free breakfast beverage for each of us each morning - coffee, juice, etc - this was very nice. There is no pool at this hotel - there is a sundeck on the 5th floor. There are chairs and a hot tub. The fitness center is also located on the sundeck (inside) - it seemed small, but we didn't use it. There were a couple of not-so-great things about the room. The sconces on the bathroom mirror had fallen slightly, so there was jagged mirror around the lights (they were high enough and on the mirror that it didn't matter). The shower doors were also strange - it is less than 1/2 covered with a glass door - water got all over the floor - easy to work around with extra towels. The last thing I'll note is that the rooms in the hotel are smaller than most. When you're making the reservation, pay attention to the sq ft size of the room. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so it didn't really matter to us.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms but awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: andrea c
Reviews.Content: We just checked in this afternoon. The staff were great and even called to say we could check in early. If you are going to stay at this Omni you should be a person who is not bothered by other peopleâ€™s dirt in your bed or bathroom. I am not that type of person. We are staying here as I type this, Easter Sunday 2012, to celebrate out wedding anniversary with a trip to NOLA and a Jacuzzi suite. The room did resemble the one on the website in a tired and worn out kind of way. I took the bed spread off the bed put it in a closet and went to go put the blanket from the plastic bag in the closet on the bed. There was a short dark curly hair on it (I am a dark blonde, it was not mine). I had room service bring another and as I was turning down the bed I found that THE SHEETS WERE STAINED. I would think they would take stained sheets out of circulation. I had to ask for another. I went to take a shower and the Jacuzzi tub had black mildew in the grout along its edges and covering the caulking. I couldnâ€™t imaging what would be in the pipes. On our way back from dinner I bought a large bottle of bleach at the cover CVS and poured it down the walls, and in the tub (mildew was growing around the jets). It did help some. But spending the first night of my anniversary vacation cleaning the room and changing the stained sheets with other peopleâ€™s body hair as my husband fell asleep waiting â€¦ not romantic. Shame on them, doesnâ€™t anyone check these rooms? It was the descent reviews that convinced me to book here. I feel either they were grossly misleading or the people posting had a far different room. I would NOT call my room CLEAN and with someone had posted about the lack of cleanliness. I took photos and if I can figure out how will post. I think it would be a shame if someone book expecting a â€œclean room and grat valueâ€� as I was and then wound up with what I wound up with.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, steff is very friendly”
Reviews.Author: futbolcoach
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant and within walking distance of everything. Nice choice when you want a good value that is away from bourbon street but still close.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but pretty run-down.”
Reviews.Author: MM_Time
Reviews.Content: I came to New Orleans for a conference and stayed here over the weekend. Location wise it is great: within walking distance of French Quarter and Bourbon Street, but it's not the best hotel ever. The rooms are small and cramped. The bathroom shower leaks no matter how hard you close the shower doors. It got so bad that the wooden door in the bathroom soaked up all the water and we couldn't close the bathroom door either. The view is also pretty bad. We were staring at a building under construction that is right across the street. Also, the elevator is quite old and really tiny (fit three people and three suitcases). However, it is clean. In general, I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 35805Anna
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here for a conference that I am attending. It is just a 20 min walk there and is within walking distance to all the major attractions. Room 409 is bright, and pleasant. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is lovely. Everything is clean and tidy, just what you hope for in a boutique style hotel. In fact my husband and I both agree that it reminds us of a lovely hotel that we stayed at in Rome; Hotel Pantheon. Jane is wonderful at the check-in area, and really started our stay in the right foot by allowing us to check-in early and assisting in any way possible. And it was such a nice touch to have a letter from the manager, Ed Cronin.What a wonderful hotel!! I would love to stay again if we travel to New Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Friendly, Clean Hotel Right Outside the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: GCBELL88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a block-and-a-half from the French Quarter so it's nice because it's very close to everything but still outside enough that it's quiet. The hotel staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. My only complaint is the bathroom isn't set up real well or at least not in our room and we were on the fourth floor. Also, the tub/shower combo just has a partial glass door which is weird and water flies out of the shower because of this no matter how you have the shower head positioned. It wouldn't make me not stay there, I just want to be informative. The hotel staff which also arrange taxis and will store your bags if you are checking out earlier than your flight. If you are a select guest too, they will accomodate you checking out later which is very nice and convenient. There is also a restaurant in the hotel that's pretty tasty at least for breakfast. One more thing, they give you beads to put on your door. Red for do not disturb and green for maid service. At least on our floor, someone took our beads, so it helps to wrap them around the door handle as opposed to just hanging them. Would definitely stay here again and can't wait for our next trip to NOLA!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Helpful Staff, Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly J
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Omni Royal Crescent in NOLA. It was a great hotel. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to my family & friends. The staff was super helpful, anything we needed(calling taxis, storing bags, etc) they were happy to help. The room was clean and comfortable. It's located about 2 blocks from the French Quarter and close to the Canal Street trolley line. We also enjoyed the restaurant "Dress It" for a few breakfasts and lunch. Great food and friendly servers.

Reviews.Title: “A Precious Gem of a Boutique”
Reviews.Author: anne g
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Royal Crescent. From check-in to check-out we were completely satisfied with our visit. The location is just close enough to walk to everywhere yet away from the constant hustle and bustle of New Orleans' party central. Front desk personnel were pleasant, helpful, accommodating and friendly. My special room requests were met and our room was very comfortable and fresh feeling. I recommend the eighth floor due to the extra ceiling height and the 'deluxe' level for extra square footage. The Omni frequent guest program is a must if you enjoy delicious coffee and juice delivered to your door(complimentary) in the morning. We would happily choose this hotel again. It provided a welcome respite to our long days and nights in New Orleans. Cute roof top deck an unexpected treat as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: runtoeat
Reviews.Content: Located in the CBD just a short walk to the French Quarter, warehouse district, Riverwalk, Convention Center and Superdome and Arena. The place is very clean and the staff is very nice. The lobby is small and elevator is close so getting in and out is very easy. This hotel is centrally located to see all of downtown New Orleans. We love to stay here. We go to New Orleans often and this is handsdown one of the cleanest hotels in the city. Nice little restuarant for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieS55chi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent for 5 nights while attending a conference at the convention center and was very impressed with the hotel's facilities and staff. The hotel is in a great location, central to all attractions and all of the staff seemed friendly and professional. I typically stay at Starwood or Hilton properties, but the Omni Reward Program may make me a convert. If you join their reward program, not only do you immediately begin earning points for free nights, but you also get great perks such as fresh coffee, tea or juice delivered to your room every morning, free wifi and free ironing services. Omni certainly knows how to appeal to business travelers. Overall it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: lrgayles
Reviews.Content: Usually, my husband and I stay in the French Quarter, but after our stay at the Omni, we will never stay in the F.Q. again. The Omni opened our eyes to hotels on the south-side of Canal street. The location is centrally located to the riverfront, Bourbon street, and the casino. All of which are within walking distance of the Omni. We even walked to Frenchmann street. This is the first time we did not rent a car and we didn't miss it. The room was small but we weren't cramped. The bathroom was nice but the shower door (rather half of a door) was a neat concept but the functionality was poor. Water was leaking onto the floor so we had to use towels to absorb the water. We didn't want to slip and fall while exiting the tub. Not good! Since our room faced Gravier street, our view was that of a brick building. I guess the view or lack thereof encourages one to get out and tour the city of NOLA! It worked. We didn't mind the view because we didn't stay in the room much. Overall, I enjoyed the property, good customer service and I would recommend the Omni to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy617
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. We got a great deal on a package but the great deal was because we agreed to a 1 double bed room. It was just us going and we don't need much room anyway. We arrived around 11am, we know check in was not until 3pm but we left our bags with them and they promised to call us when our room was ready. Unfortunatly, they never called and when we went back to the hotel around 3:15 a room was available. We didn't mind and they apologized for not calling and made it up to us by upgrading us to a king jacuzzi room! Total score! We don't spend much time in the room but we made it a point ti use the tub which was great after a long day of walking. Now we are not picky people and when we come to NOLA we dont plan to spend all of our time in the room, so we didn't mind that our view from our window was a concrete wall or that the bathroom view was of a building and their windows. We werent there for the views so it didnt bother us at all, we had a king bed and a 2 person Jacuzzi, no complaints here. We are also loyalty members and I HIGHLY recommend doing this, the perks are great. We got breakfast drinks delivered to our room every morning and water and ice delivered every evening, free wifi and the days newspaper. The hotel is located about 2 blocks from the french quarter and about 5 short blocks from borbon. Which really was a 2 minute walk. So you are far enough at night to get a quiet sleep and close enough to get in on the action.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Boutique Hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: vinoveritas59
Reviews.Content: I picked the Omni for a five night stay while attending a conference. Overall, I was very pleased with the choice. The hotel was quiet, had a good location and the staff was helpful and friendly overall. I purchased an inclusive breakfast package that featured the morning breakfast buffet located off the lobby. The breakfast was excellent, and featured a variety of offerings. The front desk staff is great, they are observant, friendly and very helpful. They assisted in everyting from hailing taxis to delivering room service. Our king suite was nice, with high ceilings. We reserved a jacuzzi suite room. We used the jacuzzi once, and it was great. The bathroom was enormous. The mattress should be replaced, it's time is up. I have a criticism with the housekeeping efforts in the room, it should be improved upon. Service was spotty, the tub was never cleaned after using the jacuzzi and the room was dusty. We ran out of toilet paper, and amenities. I requested two additional pillows to be sent up, and they were never received. My husband has asthma and it was bad during the stay. The moment we left the room, it would subside. The value overall was good for the price point, and I would stay there again, but would hope to see the cleaning issues resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great typical Omni stay”
Reviews.Author: 48Traveling
Reviews.Content: Very first time I stayed here I felt that this place wasn't up to usual Omni's standard of excellence but this time it was a different story. Omni chain has always provided a consistently great stay experience and this time the Royal Crescent lived up to the Omni's name. Join their loyalty program to get morning beverage and news paper delivered to you every morning. You will also get turndown service and free wifi. I got upgraded to a corner room with bright full length windows and large bathroom on this particular stay. Great location if you want to be near Bourbon street but also want to be able to take a break from it. Closer to the two street car lines and other buses to get to attractions around town than many hotels in the area. Helpful, friendly staff and their brand ambassador that really make you feel like a value customer. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “MARDI GRAS”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the past 4 years and I have always been pleased until now.....The staff are all very helpfull and pleasant in fact they go out of your way to make you feel special. This is where my disenchantment starts...As I checked in I proceeded to my room which was right next to elevator and the smallest room I have ever had here NOT HAPPY....I contact the front desk to ask for a reassignment Mind You I booked Early and Am a Club Member and brought 2 other couples with me.....The manager promptly comes and shows me a room smaller. I decline but am told he will move me as soon as a suitable room is found...Well that is the Last I hear from the manager....The maid service was less than prior as we did not get shampoos etc more than once during our stay...guess being a loyal customer has lost its place in todays business..

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home every night”
Reviews.Author: TravelerwKidsandWO
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights here for Mardi Gras! The hotel is a 1 1/2 blocks from st. Charles and great place to watch all the major parades. Even better you can run to your hotel for bathroom breaks. It is also a about 5 min walk to french quarter, 7,8 min to bourbon st. perfect location if you want to go have fun on Bourbon st, but not smell it all night long! Rom 707 with king bed is roomy for 2.people. Nice size bathroom. Water always hot. Absolutely Clean. It is like a beacon of light after the craziness of bourbon. Staff is friendly and helpful. All in all great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Royal Crecent NOLA Solid 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Mac4YYZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Crescent for four nights over Mardis Gras. Staff were great. Location is just a short walk from the French Quarter, the Warehouse District and a lot of great restaurants. Rooms are a little small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location during Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: TexKitKat
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Omni's Crescent location. Staff was friendly. Hotel was close but not in the French Quarter which was a bonus during busy last weekend before Mardi Gras. Join the select guest club (for free) to get free wi-fi and complimentary morning coffee service delivered to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to french quarter”
Reviews.Author: acki4711
Reviews.Content: Staying here during Mardi Gras for 6 nights. Spaceous clean rooms 2 blocks away from french quarter exactly what I was looking for. As it is my 2nd stay here I always would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Memorial Day weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie G
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed when I stayed at this hotel. All of the staff was very nice and helpful. The people I traveled with also enjoyed staying here. We had a good time in New Orleans. The only complaint I have is the fact that there are no rooms with 2 beds in it. The different websites to book hotels on does not provide this information. Other than that, I was quite pleased with everything including the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraSanClemente
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found it very enjoyable. Because it is tucked away on a side street, the rooms are quiet. The hotel and rooms remind me of a small European hotel. The room we had was actually a nice size and the bathroom was a good size as well. We didn't feel crowded at all. Omni properties are nice in that they give you a bathrobe, three sets of towels and included in the amenties is mouthwash. Little touches that make a big difference. The hotel is very convenient to the French Quarter, the Canal Shops Mall and the Convention Center. The valet parking was efficient. The hotel staff is very nice. The hotel has a small, but lively bar with a "build your own burger" dining option in the evening. There is a small computer nook in the lobby if needed. We would definitely stay here again - it is a nice change from the big hotel chains. We found it very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location With A Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: andycrna
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to its proximity to the Quarter and the port for a cruise. The hotel is neatly tucked away on a side street one block from Canal. It has a small elegant lobby with a very friendly helpful staff. The rooms are small, as you would expect with a hotel of this style, but were very comfortable and well apportioned. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom adequate with a nice shower. Small gym and sauna but with nice equipment. I would stay here again for the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Abatrel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in late January. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Room very comfortable. Was a bit noisy Saturday night but otherwise peaceful. Breakfast was wholesome and had great variety.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Nghood
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place. The location was very important to me. I wanted it to be convenient to everything but not directly in the mix. We were able to walk everywhere or pick up a trolley for anywhere else. Rooms were gorgeous. Spacious, with a spa tub, and comfortable beds. The only complaint I had was hearing the person in the bathroom in tge room next to us. Overall I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: lesliegb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a conference my husband was attending at the convention center and thought the location would be ideal for my exploring the city. I have mixed feelings about the property and would probably not stay here again. Especially since my husband could have gotten the government rate we paid at any hotel in the city. The plusses -- it is on side street that is very quiet with little street noise. The bed was fairly comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and service-oriented. It is in a great location for accessing the French Quarter and also for catching streetcars. The negatives -- the room is quite small and space is lacking to store things in the bathroom. Also, the door in the bathroom looked like someone had done a very bad repair job on. One of the strangest things was the bathroom/shower set up. The shower had a half glass shower partition. It looked like half a shower door was missing, but this was obviousy the intent as there were no screw holes on the other side. Every time we took a shower, water splattered all over the floor, leaving puddles. Also, the towels, though thick, felt like sandpaper. The shower took about 5-10 minutes before the water got hot, it was lukewarm before that. TV reception on several channels was marginal. One other thing, they have a lovely rooftop patio where the fitness center was, with chairs and chaises. However, apparently, many smoking guests use that as their smoking area, so was very unappealing for us, who are non-smokers. I did use the fitness room and the equipment was first-rate with towels, water and tv. There really isn't a pool, more like a over-size hot tub. We did join their frequent stay club, and did get our Wi-fi free and got the free coffee and juice in the morning which was nice. But at the rate we were paying which we couldn't have gotten at any hotel, I expected a nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service during trying personal circumstances”
Reviews.Author: psychodice
Reviews.Content: i had reservations for 2012 mardi gras, made sometime in august 2011 if you can believe it. i can't get into too much detail but for personal reasons i had to cancel my reservations. i chatted online with an omni representative (not from the particular hotel, but the larger omni parent company) who confirmed the policy on cancellation. i then a week later contacted the actual omni royal crescent hotel to confirm the status of my cancellation. during both conversations the employees working with me were very pleasant, kind and above all understanding of my circumstances. i can assure you that the next time i go to new orleans i will be staying at the omni royal crescent hotel, based exclusively on how their staff handled my situation. customer service is paramount to both a good experience and a repeat visit by a guest, and clearly the omni staff and those at the omni royal crescent hotel have made good customer service their priority.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here..”
Reviews.Author: AlexNRP069
Reviews.Content: This was a good location for me to walk to and from everywhere within New Orleans! I found it perfect for me who loves to walk. For some it might be far to Decatur, but it's good excercise after having a beignet or two...:) Close to French Quarter and some great places to eat! My experience was even better with the staff who treated me with friendly and local hospitality as if I go there frequently. The check in was easy, the front desk was very welcoming and every night that I went to night cap in the bar, I had a different but always fun and friendly bar tender who gave me some off the beaten path (but safe) places to go so that I didn't rely on some Travel guide. Every recommendation WAS worth it and where the locals were to have fun. Because of that, I made some great friends. Also, I went during Halloween which was super fun because of some of the staff recommendations on what to do, where to go and what to be cautious of. My room was great exactly what I would want in accomodations. My robe was fantastic,by the way. So much, that I bought one from them. The only thing I can think of that one might not find acceptable is that there isn't a large pool. There's a pool but it's a small "relax" type one. But really? Why would you go to a place like New Orleans to sit in a pool??? I can do that for free at home. Go to another hotel if you're set on a big communal pool. Otherwise, I liked that this hotel was downtown, close to everything, but not in the busy pace of it because it's situated in a quiet corner that is still accessible for cars and taxi's. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Omni”
Reviews.Author: jsccrna
Reviews.Content: I expect more from Omni's. Great locale. One block from Bourbon and Royale Street's. Two blocks from Harrahs Casino. And about 6 blocks from the Superdome if you walk. They have a great Gourmet Burger Bar called "Dress It" and it stops there. Ice machines are only on three floors. They have no drink machines because they have a deal with whomever runs "Dress it" the burger bar that all drinks alcoholic and otherwise will be purchased from there. (buy your own drinks at a store and bring them in) The maid the first night stole money off our dresser. The desk staff didn't realize we were Omni Gold Club card holders we had to tell them.(We've never had this problem before) The beds were comfortable and the pillows were great on a happy note!

Reviews.Title: “Really loved our stay here...”
Reviews.Author: grunch11
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. It's an older hotel but that added to the charm. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was located in a very safe and convenient location. It was a little off the beaten track so it was a nice retreat at the end of a long and busy day. Would recommend this to everyone and hope to return here soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy, near everything”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent the week of Thanksgiving, 2011. They seemed busy, but the staff was always quick to handle every request. Friendly and helpful. It is an older hotel, but well-kept up. Anyone can find a tiny problem here or there, but the overall feeling was great. We will return there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellygobraugh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's safe, clean and very close the the French Quarter, The Garden District and the river. It's also inexpensive and the bed was comfortable. But, honestly, that's about everything positive I have to say about it. We stayed in the standard King room and our room was right next to the elevator. The bathroom was clean but poorly laid out. For example, there was absolutely no counter space. There is barely enough counter space for one person's toiletries. We ended up having to put things on the top of the toilet. Also, the shower is tiny and there was a large, immovable bench in the shower. This is a great resource for the elderly or disabled but, for us, it was just a nuisance. Forget about taking a shower with your partner! The towels were very big, wrapping around the entire body, but they were not soft. It felt faintly of sandpaper. The room itself was small, the curtains didn't open all the way, the windows didn't open and there was a very bright light shining directly into our room from a parking lot across the street. There were no convenient outlets near the bed unless you moved the end table away from the wall and unplugged either the light or the alarm clock (I chose the alarm clock since I use my phone alarm). There is no breakfast or coffee in the lobby. They just have fresh water with lemon. Internet access is not free. It's around $10 a night. They will also tell you that, if you want to use two separate laptops, you will have to pay internet access for each laptopâ€“a total of $20 a night. If you continue to ask questions, they will eventually tell you that you can actually get access for free if you sign up for their rewards program. It's a free signup and only takes a few minutes but they don't tell you about this right away. Finally, valet parking costs $30 a night. This is just par-for-the-course for the area but it's good to know before you make a reservation here. Overall, the hotel is fine but I probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room...nightclub next door”
Reviews.Author: patl123
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel on Priceline. Excellent location...an easy walk to the French Quarter. Staff was very polite. Gym was a nice size....good for cardio, but not weight lifting. The rooftop hot tub was ok....a little run down...but still a nice way to relax after a long walk. This was an excellent value for us....and the room was very comfortable. The only problem was that we were on the 3rd floor facing the street....and there is a small bar/nightclub next door. The sound of the music wasn't too bad...but 3 out of 4 nights we were woken up (between 2-4 am) by drunk people outside....laughing/yelling/fighting. By the time we left for our next destination, we were exhausted! Did not use the small restaurant....but there is a cheap little cafe across the street that serves breakfast and lunch (Majoria?). $1 coffee and 25 cent refills. We also enjoyed a gourmet breakfast (Banana Foster french toast) around the street at Ruby Slipper (30 min+ wait). Would recommend this hotel, but at a higher floor away from the street...or bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good staff, bad for light sleepers.”
Reviews.Author: Steph H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King room at the Omni Royal Crescent, New Orleans. The room itself was nice, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was large with a nice vanity area and good amenities. Our room was cleaned and in good condition everyday, my only minor complaint is that the regular coffee for the coffee pot was not replaced one of the days we were there. Other than that everything was good with the room itself. Our room did not have a good view, it faced out to an alleyway so all we could see was a parking lot and another building. The view didn't bother us as much as the noise in the room. Often you could hear people talking in the hallways when they were talking. Generally we couldn't hear people in other rooms with the exception of one room being particularly loud late one night. We could also hear trash being picked up on the street early in the morning. This noise never woke either of us up in the morning, but if we already happened to be awake we could hear it. I'm not a light sleeper so the noise never bothered me too much but I'm guessing if you are a light sleeper that it would be difficult to sleep late at night or early in the morning. The staff was very friendly and offered us a few restaurant recommendations. They seemed more than willing to help with any issues we had. Valet parking went smoothly, the parking is valet and it cost us $29.12 a day tax included. The location is excellent we were easily able to walk to the French Quarter from the hotel. Overall I highly recommend this hotel, it was a great value for the price. The location, staff, and the size of the rooms are what makes it great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rebag2000
Reviews.Content: I like this location, great for me when I am working in the business district, but close enough to easily walk to the quarter. Very helpful staff, front desk was very knowledgeable and helpful in finding a place to recommend for lunch. They were pleasant and took time to explain directions. Rooms were quiet for the most part, definitely quieter than places closer to Canal or the quarter. Clean, relatively modern decor in rooms. My room had an interesting layout but there was plenty of space for me. I would stay there again, very convenient, quiet and located perfect for work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - would come back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_Gluck
Reviews.Content: After a long 10 days on the road, we were warmly welcomed by staff at The Omni. The room was or high quality and hotel standards are what one would expect. I highly recommend and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, a little noisy on holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: thelatraveler
Reviews.Content: We got two rooms for us and friends over New Years Eve. We got a good deal on another website when most hotels were sold out or overpriced for the holiday weekend. The hotel was wonderful. Good location and walking distance to good food (recommend Lucy's Retired Surfer's Bar & Rest. after a Saint's game, Cafe Adaleid's for breakfast and dessert or drinks and Palace Cafe), French Quarter, Riverfront, shopping, Superdome, etc. The hotel was clean, nicely furnished, and had a friendly and helpful staff. Nice comfy pillows, beds, and relaxing shower! We read a review to sign up for the free rewards program so we did and it turned out great! We took advantage of the free wi-fi, two complimentary bottles of water, beverage service in the morning, and a shoe shine. One night we went up to the rooftop pool and hot tub after walking the quarter and it was wonderful. I think it closes at 10pm but no one kicked us out at 1am while we soaked in the hot tub. Bring your swimsuit just in case! The only thing that bothered me about the hotel was the thin walls, doors and windows. We could hear people coughing in the room next to us and walking down the hall. On NYE, I could hear people as they walked down the street and yelled at 2am. I ended up playing a sound machine app from my phone to drown it out. It helped. The noise was not so bad the next night and our friends who stayed down the hall from us never had any trouble with noise so it was just a matter of room location, I guess. Overall we loved our stay and will definitely stay again! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: RandJ0806
Reviews.Content: A few disclaimers first - 1) I work in the travel industry and am probably extra picky as a result and 2) I was there at peak time and can therefore appreciate all select guest (loyalty program) requests probably could not be accommodated as a result. We planned this trip at the last minute and therefore our choice of hotels was understandably limited. We like luxury properties and Omni seemed like the best value for our travel dates. Handwritten welcome note was a nice touch. There wasn't much character here (unlike their sister property) but the location is fantastic and the room was spotless. They accommodated my request for a high floor but put us right next to the elevator when I requested to be away from it. We didn't say anything because I knew how busy it was and figured they did the best they could given their availability. Our loyalty club preferences also included extra pillows and the local newspaper. We got neither. Again, something I could've flagged but for a luxury hotel especially, I don't think I should've had to. Certainly not dealbreakers at all, just an observation. When the tub didn't drain they fixed it straightaway (we are human and things do happen) but when we mentioned the Internet was faulty the response we got was not very hospitable: try it again and if it doesn't work someone will look at it. I got a similar less-than-hospitable answer when I inquired about needing a cab to the airport. That said, the evening front desk agent was only too happy to help us with dinner reservations. Overall, if you're looking for a nice hotel in a good location, this is a good choice. If you're expecting a four star hotel WITH consistent four star service there are better options. On a sidenote - the day before we left I noticed availability at their sister property opened up. I did ask about switching our reservation but was told it could not be done which I thought was odd. Also, their sister property offers a complimentary new years party for guests - Omni crescent guests are not invited even though the room rates are the same. Would I stay at Omni again? Yes. I would just go with their other new Orleans property. But this one definitely served it's purpose just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: SchulzeM
Reviews.Content: We frequently travel to New Orleans and normally stay at Loft 523. Unfortunately, it was booked as we decided to stay at the Omni Royal Cresent since its next door to the Loft and we like the location. The hotel was decent but nothing special. The rooms weren't spacious, but werent cramped either. The beds were comfortable. One big downside is the walls are thin. After hearing the couple next to us argue and some of the awful things the husband said to his wife of 4 years, We felt like we should go next door and have recommend counseling! We didn't just hear muffled nondescript words, we could actually understand what the were saying!

Reviews.Title: “Why haven't I stayed here sooner?”
Reviews.Author: PeghandleMike
Reviews.Content: Having somehow missed out on the papa noel rates I stumbled upon a great rate here. Our early check in request was granted with lightning speed. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The room itself was very nice and clean.We had a street view thru our windows that went from floor to ceiling. The bathroom was a bit small but adequate for two adults. The only thing peculair was that the bathroom listed slightly to one side. The location is convenient just several blocks off of canal street in the CBD(central business disctric.) The St Charles streetcar is just blocks away. The streetcar provides easy access to th WWII museum, garden district, Magazine st, etc. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds, great location.”
Reviews.Author: 1686vjv
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, just a few blocks from Canal street and the French Quartrer. We had a corner room. Loved the floor to cieling windows. The room was a bit small, but we didnt spend much time in the room anyway. The beds were so comfortable. I loved that we were able to control our room temperature. Also there is no room to place all your toiletries in the bathroom. Overall I enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly at all times, even greeted us by name each time we left and came back to the hotel. I will be returning and will most definatley recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch service close to the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: cruiseauthor
Reviews.Content: We had one extra night before a conference elsewhere in New Orleans and decided to stay closer to the French Quarter. The Omni Royal Crescent is just a few steps across Canal Street from the Quarter, on a quiet street. I had pre-checked in before leaving home, and after a long delayed flight, arrived at the hotel to find our room keys ready to go, along with a hand-written note from the manager welcoming me to the hotel. Although the rooms here are on the smaller side, we had a spotless room, great bed linens (much better thread count than the other hotel we stayed at that weekend), and a roomy bathroom with all the amenities. What I loved was that because I'm a loyalty member, I got beverage service delivered to the room in the morning - real coffee, nicely presented and delivered on time. Much better than making the stuff in the hotel coffee pot. I'll stay here again the next time I get lucky enough to get back to the Big Easy...

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the Heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: miss_faw
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend in New Orleans for a conference, and after seeing the hotel rates for the conference hotels, I decided to find my own place. Ultimately, I decided to stay at the Omni Royal Crescent because of its proximity (both to the conference location and to the French Quarter) and because of its price. I could not have made a better decision! My room was on the top floor, so I had vaulted ceilings with beautiful beam work. My room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful. When I accidentally missed my return airport shuttle, they helped me get in contact with the company to make other arrangements. In addition to the hotel just being a wonderful hotel, its proximity to New Orleans' finest was great! It was a quick 5-10 minute walk to be right in the heart of the French Quarter, with Bourbon Street, Royal Street, and the Mississippi river all easily accessible. They are also just a block away from the Ruby Slipper--one of New Orleans' best breakfasts! I would certainly stay here again--it was incredibly pleasant and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome quiet hotel in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: minnesnowtachris
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to stay- very chill, pretty, albeit smallish rooms but the staff is amazing here!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, comfortable bed, nice hot tub.”
Reviews.Author: SES1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid November and can happily recommend it. The staff are just lovely and so helpful, the room was clean and had a very comfortable bed and the location was great, just a couple of streets away from the main action, so nice and quiet, but convenient too. We didn't bother with the restaurant but we did have a very relaxing soak in the outdoor hot tub. We were visiting on holiday and the staff certainly made sure we enjoyed our stay in the big easy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, relaxing stay!!”
Reviews.Author: WURA_THA_EXPLORER
Reviews.Content: My stay was near perfect, the staff members were extremely accommodating, floor to ceiling windows... I couldn't ask for more!! A great boutique hotel for those looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of the french quarter-but still have easy access to the nightlife. The bedroom and bathroom were cleaned well, and I received prompt and efficient maid service after my first night. There is no swimming pool, only a oddly placed jacuzzi for those who enjoy that sort of thing. There is a very small gym, equipped with some PRECOR cardio machines and a sauna.. nothing too spectacular. Nonetheless, if you are serious about your workout you work with what is available. Conclusively, I must add that I am an Omni Member. I set up my member profile stating my particular needs and quirks and they were really great about offering a room and services that met my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Best alternative to staying in the quarter!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLudwig
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans 5 times now, 3 of which where I stayed at the sister Omni in the quarter. When I wasn't able to snag a room there, I figured that I'd give the Crescent a shot because I was an Omni member. I was hesitant to stay outside of the quarter only because I considered the area a second home, but I was SO glad I made the move. The price was cheaper, my room was bigger, the staff is incredibly nice and it's close enough to the quarter to feel like you're in it, but quiet enough to know that you're not. If you're a first-timer to New Orleans and are looking to have fun and be part of the action, I would recommend the Omni Royal Orleans. But, if you still want to sleep at night and avoid the crowd that the quarter attracts, this is the best hotel you can stay at across Canal. I do have a couple of complaints though, hence the 4 stars....if you're looking to work off those po'boys and gumbo, don't expect to do anything but run in the gym. The room is incredibly small and only really has cardio equipment. The pool is miniscule and is basically a hot tub. The roof-top pool at the other Omni is great and offers a beautiful view of the city but for some reason they're unwilling to let guests from the Omni Royal Crescent use it. As I've said in my review of the other Omni, JOIN THE SELECT GUEST CLUB! It's free!! You get free wifi and FREE drinks, 2 per person EVERY MORNING of your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, idiosyncratic place”
Reviews.Author: jlle
Reviews.Content: I wish I could unhesitatingly recommend this hotel. The staff was great. I booked a room with a jacuzzi and was not told that all king jacuzzi rooms are "interior." In my case, it meant a window that looked out on a cement block wall about 2 feet from the window. The bathroom window also was hemmed in. It was definitely claustrophobic and not a little depressing. They did offer me a king room at the same rate but without a whirlpool, and I declined (just did not feel like moving). This was a mistake. Even though I spent little time in the room it was depressing. The biggest problem with the room was the lack of light. When I came in, I put on the wall sconces with the switch by the door. It was so dark that I walked in and bashed my shin on the bed frame. The bed and the frame were far too large for the room, leaving a narrow path between the bed and the dresser. Either the dresser should have been removed, or the room should have not bee fitted with king bed. I was in NO for a conference, and I got closed out of the main hotel. I cannot complain about the price or the location, and as I said, the staff was really nice and helpful. I just think that the hotel should be a 3 or 3.5 star, not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “A real value, Package-wise”
Reviews.Author: R_Trammell
Reviews.Content: Two blocks west of Canal from the Quarter, friendly, friendly employees, quick valet parking (since there is not a practical alternative, add $29 to your rate), and wi-fi in room (and morning coffee/paper) by free joining of Omni Select online, beforehand. Their room rate is like buying stock, changing hourly, so if you see a competitive rate, better lock it, RIGHT THEN. Safe as anywhere. Close to the great hat shop, all night convenience stores of Canal. An old warehouse, so if you have a window, you are looking at a warehouse 50 ft. away. The tradeoff is total quiet, in hallways and from outside. Full of young corporates on Iphones; not a New Orleans leisurely outdoor patio sort of place. If you are there only to start and end your day, it is above average in every way and a good deal. Only improvement: the mattress, while fine, could be replaced with the current higher up, swallow you sort of luxury. That is why you are there, to get great sleep, be it work or holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Got better after a while...”
Reviews.Author: Jane V
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 2 pm and our room was not ready for us so we left our bags in a small room next to the lobby and took a little walk. When we returned we finally got our room key and were rather appalled that the room had no windows. Felt like a tomb... The bathroom smelled like an ashtray. We asked for somebody to get rid of that smell and they put up a small machine which was supposed to suck out all the bad air in the room. Unfortunately, it did not help. Around 4.30 am our neighbors next door came home and started a nice little party, it was really loud and my smoky tumb turned into a disco. The next morning I asked for a new room - which worked out. The staff was really nice and tried their best to improve our stay. Our new room was located in one of the upper floors with real windows and no ashtray bathroom - a true relief. Also our new neighbors were not noisy and we were able to get some sleep. What I liked best was the staff. All of them were really friendly and helpful. I can only recommend a short visit to the bar; they serve pretty good burgers and the bartender is funny and nice. The location is also pretty good. It is not in the middle of the French Quarter but close enough to walk there and to many other interesting spots in the city. Since our first night was so terrible I would probably not go back to that hotel. First impression counts the most and it was just not what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Grubby Fire Hazard”
Reviews.Author: FourWinds_11
Reviews.Content: We requested a quiet room, and were assured that we were away from elevators, etc. We were given a corner room, directly over the restaurant and facing two intersecting streets. Foot traffic from the nearby French Quarter was often very noisy as groups stopped to chat (or argue loudly) right below our windows throughout the night. Our room wasn't very clean, with filthy, heavy drapes and a grubby, decorative bolster on the bed which I kept moving to the desk. Of course, the pillow was placed back on the bed whenever the room was cleaned. When we tried to place it on a shelf in the closet, we found an extra pillow and blanket in a plastic cover which had been placed too close to the closet light and there was a huge hole burned through the plastic cover and into the contents. We took it to the front desk and they were completely unconcerned, and said they didn't think it was theirs. (If not, why hadn't housekeeping noticed it when cleaning?) The hotel was fortunate the burning plastic and pillow hadn't started a fire! The overheating closet lights are a very real fire hazard! I also burned myself on the make-up mirror in the bathroom when I tried to tilt it and touched the completely exposed bulb on the back. Bathroom floor was sticky and dirty on arrival and throughout our stay, even though we left a note for housekeeping asking that it be cleaned. There was no place to connect our laptop near the desk or bed, and we ended up moving a chair into the bathroom to use it! Friendly enough staff, but when they are unresponsive that doesn't count for much. Location is very convenient to the French Quarter and a terrific restaurant called the Chophouse (formerly Curvee) is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: mklafter1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted something special for our 25th anniversary and after reading so many great reviews I thought this was the right choice. On the plus side-friendly, helpful front desk staff, champagne sent to the room, which was very nice. Unfortunately there were a number of negatives. The "fitness" room had very little equipment. The sun deck that adjoined was full of ashtrays, one of which contained a pipe of some kind. Yuck. The internet service was slow and unreliable. The walls of our room seemed to be made of paper, as we could hear every sound made by our neighbors. The restaurant was awful-it seemed like the staff had no idea how to run a food service. We arrived at the hotel at around 1:30 pm and wanted some lunch. There was one thing on the menu-burgers (beef, turkey, veggie), which came with a few different side dishes. We were told that they were out of fries because the delivery did not arrive for 4 more days. What????? Each time we came in for breakfast, most of the tables were dirty. Finally, our room was quite tiny and the one window was offset into an alcove so we got very little light. All in all, barely a 3 star hotel, definitely not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: rzombie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 13th, 2011 for 4 nights. This was our first trip to New Orleans and we wanted something fairly close to the French Quarter, but not too close to hear all the noise. My wife and I traveled there with our 7 year old and 3 year old. We had a room on the first floor, which was very nice and easily accessible. Pros: -Hotel is in a great location, just two blocks from Canal Street and only about 10 min walk to French Quarter. -The hotel is situated on a side street (Gravier) so the noise is minimum (almost non existent). -Front desk personnel was very helpful and very friendly. Cons: -The hotel room itself is average. It could use some updating, but it was clean, which was important. -Valet service was $29/day with unlimited in/out. I expected to pay this, because there is virtually no other parking within a 1-2 block radius of the hotel (only street parking meters). Overall: I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again... highly recommended. Can't give it 5 stars for the cons listed above, but if you're looking for a nice hotel with excellent service, and a great location, don't look any further. The customer service alone would make this hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Blake W
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences I've had in NOLA. Rooms were slightly on the small side, but the service, cleanliness and location more than made up for it. Location allowed exploration of Quarter and things off of Poydras Street easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and a good value”
Reviews.Author: TucsonDave
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I and my sister and brother-in-law traveled to New Orleans in Oct. of 2011. It was a first time visit for three of us. We intended to rent a house but I waited a little too long to make the reservation and the houses we wanted were all booked. After doing research here on TA we selected the Omni Royal Crescent for our hotel. It turned out to be an excellent choice. Upon check in we found our room was not quite ready, so Sarah on the front desk gave us two free drinks in the bar while we waited for our room. Sarah would prove to be very helpful on more than one occasion over the course of our three days at the hotel. We, of course, ordered hurricanes and walked around the hotel neighborhood while we waited for our room. We discovered an interesting, small diner on the corner across from the hotel where we ate breakfast the next day. The hotel is on a small side street with very little traffic. Our room was modern with a very large bathroom. Everything was exceptionally clean and the queen bed was quite comfortable. My sister and her husband were originally booked into a two double bed room (my mistake), but Sarah moved them into a king room after one night. The hotel is only about two blocks from Canal St and the French Quarter, as well as 2 blocks from St. Charles and the street car line, so it was very convenient for us as well as being just far enough away from the crazier parts of the French Quarter that street noise was never an issue. We all had a great time in New Orleans, and we would definitely stay at the Omni Royal Crescent again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly quiet!”
Reviews.Author: BrewingRover
Reviews.Content: I'll admit up front that I'm one the rare people that doesn't like New Orleans. I was there for a conference so my primary needs were quiet, proximity to food, air conditioning and a refrigerator in the room. This hotel delivered on all counts. I was amazed at how little street noise I heard, even during the day. The hotel is just off Canal, and a quick walk to the French Quarter, so there are plenty of dining options nearby. The room was fairly large for a single traveler and very comfortable. I would stay here again without hesitation. It's close to everything, yet felt away from the noisiest places.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brandy6301982
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni Royal Crescent. Our room was nicely decorated and very clean. The only set back was that the shower had half a glass door leaving the other half wide open and a bit drafty. If it weren't for that everything would've been just about perfect! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad beginning graciously corrected....”
Reviews.Author: lowthorpe
Reviews.Content: I arrived to find that the room I reserved was not ready. I was exhausted from a long travel day and I was pretty upset. I did get in to my room about five hours later after camping in a different room until my room was cleaned. The staff saved a horrible beginning. I would like to especially thank Mark Hirsch and Anna. Stacia also made a good effort to rectify a bad mistake. The hotel is very nice and excellently located. I enjoyed several very good meals in the restaurant, Dress It. I look forward to returning to the Crescent in March.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfectly Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Girl99NewYork
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but found this to be a perfectly adequate no-frills hotel. Although nobody opened the front door for us or helped us with our luggage, we did find everyone at the front desk to be friendly and helpful. The room was smallish but clean and we heard very little hallway noise and no noise from adjacent rooms. We were on a high floor so street noise was also not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible service. I will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: lingua5
Reviews.Content: The Omni Royal Crescent is probably the most welcoming hotel I have ever stayed in and that includes some B&B's as well. The staff here really goes the extra mile to take care of everything for you. I have to mention a few that made our stay beyond compare; Sarah, Jessica, and Anna - thank you for everything. The rooms are well appointed, very cleans and well maintained. They are also very quiet, which is good in a city where people are coming back to the hotel from a very late night out. The taxi driver referred to this as the "little Omni", because there is a larger Omni hotel there as well, but this is the one that I'll return to. It's just two blocks from the French Quarter and very conveniently located to everything. Once again, the Omni staff has shown that there are still hotels that know what good service is all about.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: Anna L
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans. The hotel is close to the action of the French Quarter but quiet! We got to the hotel at 9:15 am. My husband was feeling under the weather, he asked the front desk if we could have early check in. They made arrangements for my sick husband! The next day he had to go to the emergency room, the staff helped him get a cab, and helped him find the emergency room. I was blown away by the helpful staff! They went out of their way to make sure he was comfortable! The hotel is well kept and they have some of the best bloody marys in town! I will stay at the Omni every time I go to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeweledgypsy
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was very nice. It is conveniently located, so you can walk to most restaurants and attractions. It was a very quiet hotel, even though we were on the first floor. The jacuzzi bathtub was large enough that a small family could probably use it for a swimming pool! My only complaint was that throughout the night, I was awakened by loud booming sounds. The next morning I came to the conclusion that it was the sound of a shower kicking on very noisily. So either the room I was in had several rooms' showers above it, or the room above it took an awful lot of showers that night. Overall, I would recommend it, if you don't stay in room 102. Other travelers in my party didn't have the same problem on other floors.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities of a 4-star, services of a 5-star”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: A terrific bargain, great location, lovely hotel. Many of the benefits of a boutique without the cost. The front-desk staff here is beyond phenomenal - the attentiveness, service orientation, and "welcoming" spirit are unmistakable. It's the sort of reception & continuing service that we've always enjoyed at top-tier Montreal hotels: You're never at risk of being ignored or treated like a number, and get the definite message that your business is appreciated. Services here are exceptional for the price: Free overnight shoe shine. Join the Omni loyalty program and get free-wifi and free morning beverage delivered to your rooom. (Tip: Save a couple of these cards, so on your final morning you can get both o.j. AND coffee. Take along a breakfast bar, carry the tray to the sundeck and enjoy a relaxing fresh-air morning poolside with a newspaper & mini-breakfast. Greatly relaxing way to prep for the journey back home). Need a printer? They allow guests to email the front desk with a word document or pdf & they'll print it for you. (Hugely helpful if you're attending a convention). Housekeeping is first rate, too. There seems to be a good number of staff folks, and they're always pleasant. Service and value are pretty much the reason for my high rating here. The building itself is older and doesn't qualify as a 5-star. Rooms are fine - good space, nicely decororated. There's no New Orleans theme to the decor, though, which seems like a missed opportunity. My seventh-floor room was quiet - it's an older downtown hotel, but not like so many where the street noise really blasts through. Bathrobes provided, excellent bathroom amenities, and overall generous storage space. The lobby is modest and small, the gym is fully suitable without being any kind of "wow" ... and the pool is strange. It's an outdoor, very very large hot tub- you could probably fit a dozen people or more. But the water is barely above pool temperature. So it's not functioning as a hot tub, and it's way to small to be a pool. The sun deck is small but very pleasant - in the good weather, this is a great city for lying in the sun but there are very few spots to do that. The pricing here is excellent, and the value is undeniable - especially if you join the Omni loyalty program and make use of its offerings.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel that turned out not to be that cheap”
Reviews.Author: ichristiani
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 200 euros for 3 nights. Was pleased with the price until we arrived. It turned out we could not escape the valet parking of the hotel since there were no parking garages nearby. That alone added 30 dollars + tax a night to the room. Above that you have to pay a ridiculous 10 dollars a night for the WiFi in your room since it's only free in the lobby. Rooms are clean but nothing special. Did not like that the air con was placed right next to the bed and because of that the wind kept blowing in my face. The hotel is located just outside the French Quarter. Very close to Bourbon Street but in a quiet street. I did not feel very pleasant walking back at night since there are a lot of homeless people in the street and you have to walk through a quiet part of the city center. Will not book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: powellte
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, but in the ideal location for site seeing in New Orleans, we walked everywhere, room was clean and cozy (see pics). First room we were given wouldn't get warm. I called the front desk they sent maintianace up immediately, they couldn't resolved the problem so the manager switch me to another room which was a little smaller but very comfortable. The hotel restaurant has the best gumbo in town.I have no complaints about this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: Mamab2425
Reviews.Content: very helpful wonderful staff. Very nicely appointed rooms. Couple blocks from the quarter - easy to walk back and forth and feel secure. We were in a group of 6 couples and we all really loved the hotel. Only complaint was the shower doors that covered only 1/2 the tub and caused water to flow on the floor that we mopped up.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: skedoodler1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to French Quarter, easy walking to Bourbon Street, the convention center, and French Market area. You can easily pick up the trolley to the Garden District. Easy walk to most restaurants as well as Harrahs for their casino. The staff here is great and went out of their way to assist us. The rooms are on the small side, but so are most rooms in the area.

Reviews.Title: “It's an okay hotel- convenient and less pricey. Average overall.”
Reviews.Author: Ari Z
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a conference at a nearby hotel and the Omni Royal Crescent had a good price, so we booked it. It's very conveniently located 2 blocks from the French Quarter, so you don't really need a car to experience everything. A couple things we noticed: 1. The hotel staff is very friendly and always greets you. 2. The hotel is quite small and walls are kind of thin- we were woken up once in the middle of the night by people talking in a voice just above normal conversation volume. 3. Let me say a couple things about the bathroom: a. The shower door is "European" we were told. This apparently means half of the door is missing. Therefore, the whole bathroom is wet after every time someone takes a shower. b. There is no fan/vent in the bathroom c. One day we were left a towel with what appeared to be dried blood (or some other red spots) on it. d. It's quite a small bathroom 4. Housecleaning is okay (based on 3c above) and while they changed our sheets, they did leave a pillow case with some holes in it (could be due to moths or cigarette burns). 5. The water bottle in the hotel is $6, and there's no wireless but the staff was happy to let you use their computer in the back if you needed it. 6. The fitness center is just okay- 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals and 1 bike. We weren't in our room that often so it wasn't too bad. It didn't make our vacation better or worse.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, terrific value, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: DavKat
Reviews.Content: Lovely smallish (approx. 90 rooms) hotel just a few blocks from the French Quarter. My room on the top (8th floor) had high ceilings, a king bed, a big TV and an expresso maker. In general I was really pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was for a very reasonable price. Only real downsides were the "pool" (really a big hot tub) and "sundeck" (pretty small - more a big patio.) Finally - the staff here were FABULOUS. Just could not have been nicer. Got a hand written welcome note from the GM and warm welcomes from the front desk every time we passed. Really genuine and nice. Highly recommended - would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scottng15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a short stagger from the French Quarter and as such is ideal for anyone planning an assault in that area. The foyer area is immaculate and the staff were very professional and made all aspects of check-in/ check-out very easy. I used the valet parking which is expensive, but stress free. The beds were excellent, although the blankets hide the oversized frame so I banged my shins a couple of times. The shower wasn't the most powerful, considering its 4-star status. A good enough stay, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem perfectly situated just off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: McTavish_11
Reviews.Content: Having never been to New Orleans before, I had no real idea what to expect after booking in to the Omni Royal Crescent. However I knew that I wasn't going to be disappointed, when one of the reception staff dropped what she was doing to appear at the main hotel door to welcome me, before I'd even paid the taxi driver. In fact the reception staff deserve special mention; never have I stayed at a hotel anywhere in the world where the whole group of reception staff were just so helpful and friendly. Nothing was ever too much trouble for them, and they proved this to me on many occasions. The room was of an excellent size, the shower was particularly powerful, the place was perfectly air conditioned (a necessity in New Orleans), and the location was ideal in that it was just two blocks from the main Canal Street. The breakfast was spot on too, although I did miss it on one self-inflicted occasion due to overdoing it on the local alcoholic treat - the hurricane, the night before! All in all, I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone, and when I return to New Orleans (perhaps and certainly hopefully as early as next year) I'll be straight back! As I type this up on a Monday morning, with work on Wednesday, I can think of nothing more than a week ago today when I first arrived in NOLA...

Reviews.Title: “Small but great service”
Reviews.Author: miseno
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but still had all the necessities. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: lbegley
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It was a great value and it was a very short walk to the French Quarter. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: First, I want to say that the service at this hotel is fantastic. However, my stay was rather mixed and I want to highlight both the good and the bad. Good: the aforesaid fantastic service. The location is close to both the French Quarter, the Warehouse District, and only a block or so from the St. Charles Ave. streetcar line. My room was clean, with modern decor and a comfortable bed. The bathroom shower had lots of pressure. Bad: No doorman or bellman that I could see, but i didn't need one. My room did not have a luggage rack, so I had to call the front desk. One was brought immediately. My door squeaked loudly, so I again called the desk and, again, it was taken care of immediately. The air conditioner controls are rather basic (low, medium, or high) and the air blows right on you when you're in bed. The bathroom layout is horrible and there is no way two people could be in there at one time. There is only a half glass panel for the shower, so my bathroom floor flooded every morning. My biggest complaint was the noise. The windows are not double paned and so I heard every car with a stereo that drove by. On Saturday night there was an insistent bass thump coming from somewhere so at midnight I finally had to put the earbuds in my ear and fall asleep to R.E.M. Yes, it's quieter than the French Quarter, but that's a rather low bar. I was looking forward to 4 nights of great sleep and didn't get much more than in my noisy apartment back home. My room was next to the ice machine and the linen closet so during the day it was non-stop door slamming by the cleaning staff, which seemed to start rather early and precluded any naps. This is not a bad hotel by any stretch of the imagination, and has many advantages. If you're a sound sleeper, it's great. I unfortunately won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Good Location. Nice Place.”
Reviews.Author: VanTur
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is a great trip! The staff is amazing. We received emails and phone calls prior to the trip to see if there was any thing we needed to make our stay better. We were upgraded to a suit at no additional charge. I booked a great deal thru the Omni website that included breakfast and valet parking. The corner room was very large and comfortable with large sets of windows creating a panoramic view with lots of sun in the day and city lights at night. Very clean every where. It was also quiet which can be challenging in New Orleans in certain areas. It is just a few blocks off Canal St. in the Central Business District among other tall buildings which provided a city view from our high floor. The area seemed exceptionally safe even late at night. Being a fitness enthusiast, the short walk to The French Quarter is nice because of all fantastic food that is available everywhere. We parked the car using valet parking and did not use the car again until we departed. The bellmen were friendly and great with ALL of our luggage and bags. We had 2 carts of baggage due to an extended driving trip from Georgia to Texas we were on. The room allowed for lots of storage space without being cramped in the least. The breakfast buffet was sufficient and maintained by a great staff. The only issue I had with the room is the 'shower door' was a hinged panel of glass that only enclosed the shower a little over half way. It was impossible to take a shower without soaking the bathroom floor - good thing the bathroom was huge and there was an 'powder room' in the living room of the suit. Also, the refrigerator did not get very cold but they may simply be a feature for energy efficiency. Some of the decor could be updated to match the parts that have been remodeled better but it is sill nice. I really didn't like the mirrors in the hall by the elevators - it makes it feel dated - but it is all well maintained. THE STAFF IS THE BEST! We met the General Manager at check-in. He was standing at the front desk greeting people and working along side his staff. I'm not sure I have seen that at a hotel before but will say that I believe he is the reason his staff is so outstanding. The saying goes 'stuff rolls down hill', that applies to GOOD as well as BAD.
