He must lead by example. Thanks to everyone there for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lanie26
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Omni Royal Crescent. Opted for an upgrade to the DEEP tub in the bathroom -- that made the room worth it for us. The one thing I didn't like about our room was the layout. Our large bed was only about 18 inches from the dresser, so I would hit the corner of the bed almost everytime i would try to pass in between to get to the bathroom. Next time we would ask for a different layout if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: Great value at this hidden gem only a few blocks from the french qtr.. combination of convenient location .. smaller but well appointed rooms and top knotch customer service made my stay here before and after the alabama/lsu football game a treat. I had fmaily for the begining of my trip and the staff provided timely advice on places to eat and tours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic property... Great location...nice staff and management.”
Reviews.Author: fcmartin
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money and and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel near the action”
Reviews.Author: bkl99
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Gravier street is kinda dark and not very busy at night. The lobby is small and so are the rooms. Everything in the room was clean and decorated decent, but I had to be careful not to hit my head on the sink when sitting on the toilet. And the shower had half a glass wall, so the floor always got wet. Overall, the Omni Royal Crecent is a decent hotel close to Canal and Bourbon Street if you don't mind a small room and no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The feeling of a luxury boutique hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Joiedvivre
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for a few days as a last-minute getaway. The value is incredible. We booked directly with the hotel for $75/night. Definitely sign up for their rewards program, it's awesome. We requested (and got) a quiet corner room far from the elevator. Our view was great and the location is perfect. It's a block from Canal St (which divides downtown from the Quarter) and less than a 15 minute walk to Cafe Du Monde. The service was immaculate and everyone was so friendly. It sucks that they charge almost $30/night for parking but it's worth it to not hassle finding a spot. Parking is a nightmare in NOLA!!!!! The hotel is very quiet, the bartender was great, and although we didn't try the restaurant, right nearby is breakfast and lunch at Commerce or the Ruby Slipper, both wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel and located walking distance to food.”
Reviews.Author: Mrm2u2004
Reviews.Content: If a family ofbecky may be a litlle crowded because the rooms are small, staff is greatîŒ·Older hotel but kept up quite well. You can save $30 and park on the street from 6p-8a.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, everything you need and then some.”
Reviews.Author: mtstang
Reviews.Content: Location: awesome!..This hotel is only 2 blocks away from the French quarter and the famous bourbon street, so you can easily walk there every day or night for dinner, drinks and entertainment. The walk is safe and very well lit; we walked home every night times between 11pm and 4 am. And never felt even a bit worried. Hotel: rooms are very clean, service is awesome, greeted every time you return to the lobby and room service is great. One day we never left the room till after 5pm (too much to drink until the wee hours of the morning...hey itâ€™s a holiday!) we came back after supper our room was clean, new sheets the works. We were amazed and very happy. there is a roof top hot tub, great for the evening you want to just relax and have a bottle of wine, as there is so many other things to do often you could be alone here if you so choose. Restaurant in the hotel is very fast friendly and great to get you going in the morning or early afternoon. Gym. There are 4 pieces of cardio equipment if you wanted to work out. No free weights but ok for a quick work out. SUMMARY: yes I would stay here again. Service was great, room was always clean with turn down service in the evening, staffs are very helpful. And far enough away you donâ€™t here the constant party but close enough you can stumble home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel very close to Canal Street”
Reviews.Author: jhec
Reviews.Content: Very good location for getting around downtown New Orleans and the hotel has extremely comfortable rooms. However, the best feature of this lovely place to stay is the attentiveness and friendliness of the front desk staff - we had had our flight cancelled from Chicago and missed the first night of our planned four-night stay. When we arrived at the Omni, nothing was too much trouble for the young Russian lady on the front desk - all the staff we encountered showed the same degree of professionalism and warmth: we were even greeted by name by one staff member. We wouldn't stay anywhere else should we return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with my choice.”
Reviews.Author: Footloose39
Reviews.Content: This place was the perfect spot for an overnight stay in New Orleans. It is about a ten minute walk to Mr B's Bistro (BBQ shrimp takeout from the bar) and Cafe Beignet (omG get a fresh praline to have with coffee for dessert later). The hotel itself was such a nice experience, pretty old place renovated nicely. The room was small but nicely done and up to date with everything you could need. Had a wonderful nights sleep before having to get up early for the train. Staff was very nice and helpful! Again people, bid on priceline for your room...$55. a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better service”
Reviews.Author: thehups
Reviews.Content: In town for the Junior Olympics, my first thought was to stay at both a nice hotel and one away from the noise of the Quarter. As an Omni Select Guest member, contacted the hotel needing help on room types which is where Sarah took over. Both before and during our stay, Sarah was absolutely amazing with taking care of anything I could think of (and even those I didn't). My kids thought she was the coolest as she noted even the smallest of details to make this a great stay for all of us. I've stayed at seven different Omni properties over the past two years and have never received service like at the Omni Royal Crescent. We had an interior suite without a view which, to be honest, I was a bit hesitant about. However, that was quickly removed as we had a perfect nightâ€™s sleep without any street noise, guest noise or noise in general. The size of rooms here are much bigger, nicer and less expensive than the Omni in the Quarter so factor that into your planning. I loved being a few blocks west of Canal Street where you could avoid the noise and crowds yet are there in less than 5 minutes if the action is where you wanted to be. We never felt unsafe walking the area at night and were greeted, by name, each time we returned. Walking distance to Luke, August and a very short cab ride to Emeril's and Cochon so great restaurants are not a problem. For bars there are quite a few close to the hotel that didn't require you to venture onto Bourbon Street so you could enjoy your conversation and drinks from a glass, not a green plastic grenade. Everyone at this hotel, from the general manager on down, is genuinely helpful with Sarah being the shining star. This Omni is at the top of my list the next time I return!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sexygirl63_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to New Orleans every year norm ally staying at the LaQuinta, but for this trip decided to try a different hotel.the thing that caught my husband's attention was the jacuzzi bath. So anyway upon arrival I was turned off when we drove up and their was no guest parking you had to pay extra for valet. The room was even worst very small for the amount of money we spent ,no Wi Fi, no view just a brick wall, refrigerator did not work, no complimentary breakfast or nothing the bottle of water in the room was $8.00, the room was hot could not adjust the air and poor lighting. We also paid extra for our dogs only to get told that we could not leave them along because they were barking and disturbing the guest(why not a dog floor like the LaQuinta offer.) so we had to cut our trip short because there were no other hotel available because of the festival never, never will we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingkr2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during our anniversary. The location was great. Nice to be close to Canal & Bourbon Street. Gravier St. is 2-3 blocks from Canal St. so you miss all of the traffic noise which is nice. We walked to Bourbon Street, Harrahs, Canal, The Waterfront, The Riverwalk, The War Museum, etc with no problem. We decided not to rent a car and it worked out perfectly. This hotel is very nice. We would definitely stay here again. We did not eat at the restaurant during our stay. It is rather small and limited on items they serve. We did order room serve and the salad was fine for a late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandpthomas
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni Royal Crescent took our experience to a whole new level. This was our first time to New Orleans and decided to stay at the Omni Royal Crescent to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary. My husband called and talked to Sarah, who is over guest relations, and she was such a tremendous help. She worked with husband to arrange some anniversary surprises before our trip and then made sure that everything was timed correctly while we were there. She also went out of her way to make sure that we were enjoying our stay, found the best places to eat and hang out, and always had a warm greeting and smile. She, along with the other Omni staff members truly made this the best anniversary that we have ever had. We loved the room and thought that the valet cost was worth it for the night because we were able to take the car at any time to go out. Overall we highly highly recommend the Omni Royal Crescent!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BoBoMaMa
Reviews.Content: We are extremely happy about this hotel. The room was beautifully decorated, clean, staff was very friendly & helpful. The location was excellent and only minutes away by walking distance to the French Quarter. Therefore it was very conveniently located. To us, it was a very pleasant stay indeed. Our room has a lovely view but we know there are rooms in this hotel which are facing a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great location...great staff”
Reviews.Author: PatrickKaler
Reviews.Content: Was in NOLA attending a convention at a nearby hotel, read reviews of that hotel and decided to find another place to stay...found the Omni a block away. The Omni Royal Crescent Hotel was perfect. I got the room and breakfast each morning for $70 less than the rate at the convention hotel. The room was clean, the staff was wonderful and the breakfast was great. The location is fantastic...only a few blocks from Bourbon Street...and other great restaurants nearby. I highly suggest a stay at the Omni Royal Crescent (there is more than one Omni in NOLA) your next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, A-”
Reviews.Author: davem60612
Reviews.Content: Wife, daughter and I spent a week in march 2011 here. Very nice, professional staff. Properly clean rooms and common areas, even the gym and pool! Location is good, not in anything but close to everything. The price of our stay was very nice, averaged $100 per day after taxes and fees. Only minor gripes; wifi never did work even after repeated calls for help, and the odd shower arrangement would soak anything in the bathroom during a shower, no matter how careful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Silawe
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel in a great location but I found the staff to be very friendly and honest. We arrived around 8pm on a Saturday night and the concierge giggled at us when we asked if we could get into Jacques-Imo's Cafe. Okay some may have been insulted by the giggle but it was not mean spirited and he ended up leading us to Luke's (a John Besh restaurant) just a block away. It was great! Our bed was really comfortable and the room was spotless. I would definitely stay here again!!!! 1 complaint and it is minor but this hotel does not have a real pool so forget about that and enjoy NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lot of noise”
Reviews.Author: diceman13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nothing special just average which is fine by me.They where doing work on entance when I was there.Had fridge in room and that was nice,room again just average,only big complaint is door to room has "huge gaps" so lot of light gets in,i put blanket ii front to help,but could not drown out the noise of the room arcoss the hall.You could hear every word they said and hear every thing this man did with the woman he paid $500.I only know this because like i said i heard every word.So if you want a quite room to sleep this is "not" the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great! But BEWARE of parking issues...”
Reviews.Author: Sollibaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the positive TripAdvisor reviews, so going into this stay, I had extremely high expectations and critically reviewed all aspects of this stay. This hotel is beautiful, and it looked like it has been renovated not too long ago. I think the selling point of this hotel is their customer service and location. The hotel is out of the French Quarter and is in a quieter part of the CBD, but when booking this hotel please request that you get an upper floor room because the windows are old and do not block out much street noise. My trip started off HORRIBLE. My partner and I were driving into New Orleans for a concert, and we got stuck in some serious traffic and delayed our arrival by about two hours. Both of us were in a rush to get checked-in and get ready so we could head out to the show. With that being said, you could only imagine how frustrated I was with the numerous amount of delays. The icing on the cake was when I finally made it into New Orleans, the street that this hotel is located on (Gravier St) was closed because of some construction or something. We could not park in front of the hotel, so we had to drive several blocks away just to even park our car to check in - AND it was raining. Now, I know this is out of the control of the hotel since the city blocked off the street, but what annoyed me more than anything is that when I checked in to see what my parking options were (since obviously it wasn't going to be valet), the lady, who I believe was named Sarah, told me that I could drive around again and give my keys to to the valet guys at the LaQuinta across the street. She suggested this because supposedly both the Omni and the LaQuinta use the same parking garage for their valet service. WTF? How is this valet? It was very inconvenient and I felt very uncomfortable giving my car away to another hotel. We decided not to even do that and self-parked at the Whitney Bank garage instead. This was not fun and we had to make several trips back and forth from the garage to bring all of our luggage in. I only wished that the hotel would have called me to let me know that there was going to be trouble getting to the hotel since the streets were closed, so I would have taken an alternative route and made adjustments for parking. Other that that the hotel is nice and is great for the money we paid. The hotel is small, but it felt more intimate than some of the larger hotels in New Orleans (Sheraton/Marriott). The staff is extremely friendly and will greet you everytime you pass through the lobby, but it can be a little superficial after a while. The rooms are very nice, and are comparable to The Roosevelt Hotel (Waldorf Astoria) in New Orleans. The furniture was of higher quality than of other chain hotels as well. Biggest tip that I can give you is to sign up for the Select Guest rewards program through the Omni website. This allowed us to get free internet, morning beverages, and a newspaper. In addition, we saved 20% off of the room rate by doing this.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ebach17
Reviews.Content: As far as location is concerned, this is a great spot and the hotel's strongest selling point. Relatively speaking the value for money is good too. We stayed a total of 4 nights in two separate stays. Our first few nights really left us with the impression that management wasn't around much. The front desk staff were superficially polite but very slow to actually help. I called ahead to arrange a crib in the room, which wasn't done. When we got to the hotel I asked again and hours later it still wasn't done. Asking about local tours or restaurant options wasn't something they were very helpful with either. They were basically there to just check people in and out and not much else. You really got the feeling they were going through the motions and doing the bear minimum. Getting a luggage trolley was also very hard. We had many items and on more than one occassion they had no idea where to find it. One staff member claimed to have never seen one. We accidently left an empty suitase in the closet of our room. I called 2 days later to find that they had no record of any such item. It just vanished, and they weren't too concerned about it. So, be very wary of leaving anything behind here. Odds are it will disappear. I checked in again 3 days after my original stay and had a very different experience. I was greeted by what seemed to be a manager who was very attentive. Our previous stay really left me with a poor impression of the hotel. The facilities themselves were fair, just a bit run down. Chipped furniture, and cracked sinks aren't such a big deal if you have good people running the hotel. By all means if you know New Orleans very well and just need somewhere to lay your head choose this hotel. If you want a hotel with a friendly, conscientious staff who can help you with your stay, this is not the hotel for you. There is an inconsistency in the quality of staff. Once management corrects this issue I'm sure it will be a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddylev
Reviews.Content: Echoing the sentiments of other reviewers, this place is a gem. Prfect walking distance to the quarter and all the fun spots, but quiet at night. Staff is phenomenal and will truly take care of you. Beds are great, rooms are fine size, and value is exceptional. We just paid 85 a night for a 3 night thurs-sun stay and this will def be my go to hotel for future Nola trips

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ru38
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon based on the Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Join the Omni Select guest for free and get free WIFI, free beverages and paper in the morning. We received a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival (because it was our honeymoon). A handwritten note from the manager with his mobile number. turn down service every night. Huge bed. Great aircon. Two blocks from French Quarter. Very helpful reception staff. You have to pay for Valet but that is pretty standard in NOLA. The pool was rather amusing - basically a big bath - but we weren't there for swimming so it was fine. Nice little gym. I cannot stress what fantastic value for money this was. And you are not having to compromise on luxury. We will be staying there next time we are in New Orleans. The burger restaurant seemed pleasant enough - but when you are in new Orleans it seems silly to eat in a hotel!!!!Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - everything about it was amazing - Service Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: besdogs3
Reviews.Content: Went to Jazz Fest for work. Stayed at this hotel and Loved everything about it. Such a nice small feel to the lobby and the Service was so wonderful. Opening doors for us, had some water with lemon ready for us on arrival. Had such a big room with a comfy bed and a huge tub with shower.. a little hard to get into though. First night woke up to water dripping in my bed from the room above or something. Called service desk and they moved me immediately. No hassel at all. Very helpful giving us directions to shuttles for the Fest and how to get to Bourbon st and our places we wanted to go eat. I felt that they were genuine and happy to help. Best service ever at a hotel. We loved the feel of this hotel and how well we were treated and have already reserved rooms for next year for Jazz Fest to make sure that we can stay here again. A little pricy but worth every penny. Walking distance to everything and we didn't take a cab one time.

Reviews.Title: “Decaying grandeur, great location, but you will need ear-plugs”
Reviews.Author: HaveSuitcaseWillTrvl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a couple of blocks from Canal Street and the French Quarter and within easy walking distance of most downtown sights and the convention center. Trolley stops along Canal Street make it easy to get to most tourist spots within the city, including the cemetaries, garden district and riverwalk. The trolley from Canal Street to the French Market is under construction this summer, however, it is really not far to walk through the French Quarter to Cafe du Monde and the shops. The hotel staff are some of the best I have ever encountered. Anna was especially friendly and charming throughout my multi-day stay. The hotel reflects an aged elegance and is quite cozy. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. My only real issue with this hotel was the noise from the street (there is a night club a couple of doors down from the hotel) and noise from nearby rooms. The second night I was there a couple with children checked into the room next to mine and one of the kids screamed ALL night and everyone at our end of the short hallway endured it. I travel with ear-plugs and they could not even block that out. I had never experienced this level of noise from a nearby room. Had it not been for this incident, the only noise would have been from the street below--which I assumed was due to the old windows which may be part of the original facade and therefore un-fixable in a historic district. However, noise from nearby rooms and the hallway should be dealt with. Another caveat is the room I had was VERY small, which was not a problem for me as I was traveling by myself to a conference, however, might be a problem for a couple. But then again, the hotel may assign rooms based on number of people staying in the room and therefore a couple would not be assigned to a very small room. The historic details of the rooms (odd shape, floor-to-ceiling paned windows, moldings etc) were part of the charm of the hotel, so if you like old buildings you will probably enjoy your stay here. Were it not for the noise issues I experienced while staying here I would have given the hotel 4-stars, however, due to the noise I am not sure I would stay here again and therefore don't want to give it too high a rating.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Friendly Oasis”
Reviews.Author: FoodNomad53
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively small, almost boutique-like hotel just two blocks from Canal Street and the French Quarter. We stayed on the 8th (top) floor where it was very peaceful and quiet. The room & bathroom was spotless. King size bed was like sleeping at home. The air conditioning is very capable & quiet (we turned the temperature up to better suit our preferred range). The front desk staff was pleasant, professional and efficient. There was a card in our room on arrival from the hotel manager, which included his cell phone number should we need anything. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Just Can't Do Better than This.”
Reviews.Author: Rickwine
Reviews.Content: If you are in New Orleans and not staying at this hotel you have made a mistake. The hotel is exceptional in every way. Let me just point out how they achieved this distinction. Before I even arrived at the hotel I had experienced a reservation agent who was kind and helpful. The rates were outstanding for New Orleans but especially for a hotel of this class. A couple days before I arrived there was an advanced check-in offered. When I arrived at the hotel it took me about 3 minutes to get to my room. My room was small but it was comfortable and spotless. The bed was very comfortable. The air conditioning worked well. The bathroom was spotless and well equipped. I had the usual amenitites such as robes and a nice coffee pot. The maid left me extra coffee every day. I asked for a refrigerator and it arrived in about 5 minutes. So check this out. I had some friends staying at a nearby hotel who wanted to come over and drink some excellent old wine they had brought for us to try. I needed a wine decanter. The front desk checked with the restaruant and they did not have one. So the front desk folks went to work and found a great substitute for me. The polished it up and even provided some clean filter material and wine glasses. This is above and beyond the call. When I wanted to print my boarding pass they did not just point me at a public computer. They printed it for me and had it at the front desk for me to pick up. They have wireless internet and it was free to club members. (Club membership is free also by the way.) And the internet was pretty fast unlike most hotel wireless. THe restaurant is small, great food and affordable. I was not very hungry one evening so the chef made me a moderate sized dish of red beans and rice with cajun sausage which was just right. You have to try their hamburgers by the way. They are excellent. Every member of the staff had a smile for me and many remembered my name. I really felt at home and well cared for. I travel a lot and I believe hold the bar pretty high. This hotel really got my attention. When I return to New Orleans I will not even think of staying anywhere else. If you are a professional traveler this is the oasis you are looking for. If you are in New Orleans for vacation it is right in the middle of everything and the staff will help you enjoy your visit. This is the hotel you should choose in New Orleans. You just can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: P_B_Kemah
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to the New Orleans area for business and this is my "go to" hotel. The prices are reasonable and the staff is teriffic. It's location make it great for getting in and out of the city. I love being able to walk to a great restaurant for dinner. If you like the casino, it's walking distance from there as well. If you're looking for a home-style breakfast at a good price, check out the Commerce Restaurant across the street. This is one place I can get my spouse to accompany me on a business trip. They do charge for parking, so add that to your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WatermanWife
Reviews.Content: My husband came to stay at this hotel after leaving another hotel due to poor accommodations. I was able to book a room the same day of our stay. They were able to accommodate our request for early check in. The room was beautiful. We were in a corner room that had windows galore on two sides of the room and overlooked the street. Noise did penetrate the windows but due to the hotel being away from the noise of the French Quarter proper after dark the noise dropped off considerably. The bed was comfortable and my husband and I slept well out entire 5 night stay. The fitness room consists of two elliptical and treadmill machines, yoga mats, and a stretch machine and his and her sauna's. The roof deck with jacuzzi pool and lounge chairs, and recliners was very welcoming. Consider joining the select guest loyalty program (free) which will entitle you to free Wi-Fi (which is a little slow) and free a.m. beverages and newspaper delivered to your room. Staff is incredibly accommodating and was able to answer all of my questions about the hotel and local area. The hotel only offers valet parking. You can park on your own at any of the surface lots within a block of the hotel for a lot less. I look forward to staying at an Omni Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel made excellent by their staff”
Reviews.Author: lizziefin
Reviews.Content: This was an affiliate hotel for the IFT convention and it was great. The rooms were spacious and airy. The lobby was fine, (ice water available at all times) the bar a little small and narrow and closed early ( I suppose they expected everyone to be out on Bourbon Street!). The key differentiator for me here was the staff, specially the young women who worked on the front desk. They were knowledgeable about their city, they were warm and friendly and they always welcomed you through the front doors with a smile. The technical support (I had an internet problem) were also very good indeed. I shall return here when I am next in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aal1060
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel! Great location- easily within walking distance to casino, streetcar line, and french quarter. Great service! Would definately come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: OrangeLeopard
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Elegant and quiet--not in the French Quarter, per se, but only a couple of blocks across Canal--much better than staying in the FQ, which can be noisy and stinky (sorry, NOLA, love ya but ya know it's true). Convenient to both the FQ and the CBD. Staff was super nice and very helpful. Bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3seasonedtravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Omni Royal Crescent. it was located just outside the french quarter, which was wonderful because it was quite. The hotel is within walking distance of the streetcar line. We took the streetcar to the french quarter and the garden district. The hotel staff was very personable. They gave greeted us by name and gave our daughter a welcome package filled toys and goodies. We booked the breakfast package so we ate both morning at Dress It. The food was okay for a buffet. They didn't have a chef prepared omlet bar. I've had better buffets at other Omni hotels for the same price. Since we are Omni select guest members we received complimentary beverage delivered to our room each morning and we received bottled water each night with our turn down service. Each evening we came home the staff greeted us an asked us about our evening. We were treated like family and not just a number like the big chain hotels. Some of the drawbacks to the hotel. The rooms are newly renovated, but a little small. The bathrooms are newly renovated with granite and tile, but the half glass door in the shower was a very poor design. We had to place towels on the floor each day to catch all the water coming out of the shower. I can see this eventually leading to mold problem with the amount of water sitting on the floors each day. It's a shame because it's a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bvnathan
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very elegant boutique hotel, w. very convenient location. Beautiful rooms and bathroom, comfortable bed. Excellent catering for our business meetings Cons: no free internet in room; fitness center is rather small

Reviews.Title: “We endured it................”
Reviews.Author: RotarianSW
Reviews.Content: The service was great at check in and as well the bar and restaurant.....very friendly and cordial. I liked the response time from the front desk. The room was much, much, smaller than I anticipated since I asked to be place in a superior king . The bathroom was very small. The cost of parking was outrageous for the week. The location was great it is within walking distance to the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Hospitality is Alive and Well in the Big Easy!”
Reviews.Author: Spayne4328
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New Orleans for a last minute weekend getaway. I booked our hotel on-line and thought I got a great deal. But, once we got there it was even better than we could have imagined! From the minute we pulled up, we were greeted outside by the front desk manager, who also arranged for our cab to take us to dinner. Our room was ready with fresh ice, water and a special local treat! They upgraded us as well to a luxurious room with two king beds, two bathrooms, on the corner - it was beautiful and so comfortable! Each time we walked into the lobby we were greeted and asked if there was anything we needed. We went into the hotel bar for a drink before dinner and got the opportunity to talk with Layla who made appetizer suggestions at the restaurant where we were having dinner. She was so personable and so helpful. We had a drink and after changing for dinner, our cab was outside waiting for us. When we came back, again we were asked by the front desk if we needed anything. At breakfast in Dress It, we were asked several times if there was anything we needed - it was a buffet - great selection which was awesome - everything was hot and fresh and again, the personal attention they showed to us was refreshing. As we went outside after check out and were waiting for our car, we were asked if we were checking out and how our stay was. The gentlemen asked if we would be coming back or if there was anything else they could do to make our stay better. We could not think of anything - it was perfect. As a matter of fact, we tried to book a room for the following weekend after we learned of all the festivals going on - but wouldn't you know it, they were sold out! No surprise - it was so nice to see true customer service at it's finest!

Reviews.Title: “SOUTHERN HOSPITALITY AT ITS BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kittiekat27
Reviews.Content: After a 20 hour amtrak ride from Chicago to New Orleans we were greeted getting out of our taxi. Thats right, she came OUTSIDE to the side walk to welcome us. My 7 year old son recieved a paper "bookbag" containing a few small toys, twizzlers (which I was asked about prior to him recieving it) and a small paper wildflower bomb to plant at home. Upstairs we found our room impeccably clean and with a handwriten note welcoming us and with the phone numbers of the manager in case of any concerns. If you sign up for their rewards program you get assorted perks, includind a beverage delivered to your room each morning. The staff was so helpful and friendly, looking up multiple addresses and times online (I had her on the phone from my room.) While dooroes allow the room to get soaked if you use the bath mat it would be impossible to fall, and we had a peacefull nights rest each night. Its literally steps from the French Quarter and the streetcar lines. Eat at Verti Mart its only a few blocks away on Royal street, and you've got yourself a little slice of heaven in the middle of New Orleans. I cant imagine staying anywhere else on future trips to NOLA. Id like to give it ten stars I felt pamered and impressed and not at all like I only spent $109 per night. I'll miss you Omni Royal Crescent and all your attention to the little things!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyPes
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at the hotel was very helpful. I tore my ACL 2 days before our arrival and wasn't walking very well so I called ahead and asked for a wheelchair. The chair was waiting when we arrived and the staff thoughtfully put me on the first floor. They had many restaurant suggestions and made us feel right at home. The room was large by New Orleans standards, quiet and very comfortable. Overall a very good hotel and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Tricky”
Reviews.Author: ATLcruiser
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times now. The first time I had a beautiful corner room with walls of windows. It was a little noisy on the street, but nothing you couldn't sleep through. The second time I got a regular room that fronted Gravier, but it was quiet. The third time I got a similar room, but I had noisy neighbors, so I asked to be moved on day two. The only available room was one of those tiny rooms down the twisty hall that had a queen bed and no chair. The room was tiny, but most of the rooms at this hotel are on the small side. It was a higher floor and appeared to be recently renovated. I wanted peace and quiet and that is what I got. I am never interested in views in New Orleans, so the fact that the window was behind the TV and looked out on a parking deck did not bother me. The staff is always very friendly, and the restaurant is great for a take out burger if you are working in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valene444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I moved to this hotel from another one that we were staying in that was horrible. This hotel was like night and day to the other hotel. The lobby was welcoming, the front desk staff were amazing, and the rooms were wonderful. The room was immaculate. Little details like housekeeping coming by every evening with a bag of ice if we needed it, free coffee and juice delivered to our room in the morning made the stay even more special. I can't speak highly enough about the Omni. We hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...few things to complain about.”
Reviews.Author: patrick_oborski
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for two days....The hotel lobby was very nice and the people working there were always friendly and professional. The location is perfect if you want to be close to the French Quarter but not in it. Room was clean. Was a little dissapointed with a couple things. Felt it was a little pricey for what we got in return. After spending the night (bed was comfortable) The following day we got up and returned around 4pm and were surprised to find our room was still not cleaned and no new towels or bedding. Called down to front desk and they asked if I had left red beeds on the door which we didn't and they informed me that housekeeping works from 9am-5pm and it being 4pm they might not have got too it yet....thought that was a little late in the day after being tired from walking everywhere to deal with it. I did sign up for the select member program after reviewing tripadvisor, It really didnt make any difference in preferential treatment. We arrived at noon the day before and knew we were a bit early for checkin but were willing to go look around the french quarter until rooms were ready, said they would call me when it was ready. We came back about 30 minutes early at 2:30pm (30 minutes before official checkin) Were informed the room I had reserved still wasnt ready. The front desk person asked me if it was important to have a jucuzzi (which is what I paid for) only to offer me a window view room which was available right now. Slight dissapointment ....Overall the hotel is nice. The valet parking was a ripoff and considering we brought two cars I paid through the nose for them just to be parked at the LaQuinta.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: erhof
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews, I was excited to have a stay at this property during a recent business trip. Unfortunately, I was put into a room that was completely unpleasant and unsuited to business travel. The room was so small that there was no chair, no desk, making it difficult for me as a business traveler with deadlines to meet. In addition, the room was very dark and claustrophobic, because the only window was completely obscured by a dresser topped by a television. I couldn't reach past the TV to open the draperies or look outside. The space was dark and devoid of natural light. The room was too hot, and the temperature controls had no effect on this problem. The bathroom was squeezed into the space, and the door kept closing into my back as I stood at the sink. The facility is very clean and the staff are friendly and accomodating,which helped offset my frustrations. They told me when I checked out that this room was only assigned when the hotel was very full. I might have felt differently if someone told me in advance that I was going to get a substandard room assignment, or if there was a price adjustment for suffering through my time here. So if you decide to stay here, watch out and be sure you don't get stuck with room number 611 or a similarly appointed room in times when the city is booked with a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: kandicef
Reviews.Content: Room temperature impossible to regulate. Linnens on bed smelly. Food on breakfast buffet that is supposed to be hot is cold 2 days in a row I have always stayed here but will find a new place.. Lots to choose from.'

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: I officially love Omni. They never disappoint me. This place has a great location very close to Canal St. and the French Quarter. Staff was super nice and we were granted an early check-in during Jazz Fest which was a pleasant surprise. Everything was clean and the bed was really comfortable. You use beads on your door knob (red for privacy), a really nice touch. The only problem was the shower door only covered half way through the tub so everything would get wet outside. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for comfort and quiet close to but not in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms in this boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: exploreforfun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within easy walking distance from Canal street and the French Quarter, as well as the business district. The rooms are nicely appointed and have high ceilings and the sixth floor exercise room, hot tub and saunas are a nice treat. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome, and having free beverages delivered to your room every morning starts the day off right.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: septemberjen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent-staff is very friendly and professional,it is beautiful and we had a fabulous time sight-seeing from this central location. The room was immaculate with quality ammenities, valet parking was speedy and convenient. We would definitely stay here again if in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...location key!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaLover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcome gem that I found on trip advisor and followed through with it. It was a great location, quiet, rooms were nice, shower door sucks, service was awesome. I would definitely stay there again. I became a preferred customer by signing up on line and had a handwritten note in my room upon arrival, so impressive. The only downside was the shower door really, but I cut down on the water all over the floor, by blocking the open area with my body, so I took a sideways, very short shower.

Reviews.Title: “A Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: lalaantalover
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Omni Royal Crescent in New Orleans for my birthday. Check in was a breeze had joined Omni Select Guest (for free ) and had pre selected room preferences. Our room was very smart and stylish and I had a personally signed birthday card and note with cell phone contact from the hotel manager. Daily with the select guest we had hot and cold beverages delivered to our room first thing in the morning. I must say it was really nice to enjoy coffee in bed with my hubby. The coffee was local too it was New Orleans own Community Coffee. A great way to start off the day. As well as free wi-fi for Select Guest. For those reviews that say it is off the beaten path. I would say it is one of the most central located hotels. It was only a few short blocks to the French Quarter. moments away from St. Charles Street to catch the street car to Garden District. I don't think I would stay anywhere else in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AU046
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor and generally was all accurate. It's off the beaten path of Boubon St, but that's a GOOD thing. The Arts-Warehouse district is really close by - within walking distance to everything - and very clean. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful and the room was very nice. My only issue was the king mattress seemed a bit too soft for my taste. It sunk in the middle just a little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: travelbirds0809
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the hotel's small appearance from the outside. The rooms are large, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. The location is great...about a 5-7 minute walk to the French Quarter. Stay here! You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Hootsmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights visiting NOLA - chose it because of comments and rating on Trip Advisor. Arrived well before check in time - not only was our room ready, we were upgraded to a junior suite! LOVELY!!!! We were on the top floor in the corner - we had five sets of windows giving an great view of two streets - and I went to sleep each night to the sight of the Capital One building all lit up - red, white and blue! Room was spotless, safe was easy to use, bathrooms were nice, but I agree that the shower doors need changing - they really don't stop the floor from flooding badly. Felt sorry for housekeeping. Staff were all very friendly - and helpful, answering every question we asked. The taxi back to the airport was ordered by the front desk the night before we left - driver was early and very friendly. Due to very heavy rain and tornado warnings on our second night, we ate in the hotel. Dress It is a a great place! You can so easily choose what goes on your burger - really great tasting food, good service and an asset to the hotel. All in all, we loved staying here and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Only sorry we didn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility Amidst NOLA'S Beloved Chaos”
Reviews.Author: LAPlatinum
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It is only two, tiny blocks from Canal Street and so it is quiet, but still in perfect proximity to absolutely everything you need in NOLA. Here is the scoop: Check-in: Flawless and instantaneous. Fresh apples and flavored ice water to greet you. I needed to change the credit card I was using and I noted later when I checked the card online that the refund on the one card I no longer wanted to use was quick. I was particularly impressed with this because I have had problems with other hotels in the past who have double-charged, over-charged, and so on. Room: The hotel was sold out because of the conference I was attending, along with the NOLA Jazz Festival and I arrived in my room, which I had specifically requested not be near the elevator because of the noise factor. The hotel has a no smoking policy throughout, but this room clearly reeked of smoke. I called the front desk and Jessica told me that she would show me various rooms and move me, but warned me that the only rooms were near the elevator. A bit disheartening, but I settled on a lovely room on the seventh floor that was just around the corner from the elevator. The good news was that not only was the room quiet, but over a five-day period, I heard almost no one at any time. NO elevator noise, no people noise, no employee noise. Just blissful silence! The room was generous in size and nicely appointed. Lots of space to unpack everything and hang up clothes. Great size safe to stash my laptop (not that I was worried, anyway!). Tons of towels in the bathroom, an extra blanket for the bed, and amazingly fluffy, feather pillows. Complimentary Internet for Omni Select Guests, so join up! Room Service: Excellent Caesar salad and shrimp remoulade. Generous servings of both appetizers and I could not even begin to consider any more food. If you join Omni Select Guests, you will receive your choice of two beverages at no charge every morning. I loved the gourmet tea and fresh orange juice. Only complaint: they used to include a complimentary breakfast bread such as a croissant, but now they charge for these. Bathroom: I travel in Europe quite a lot and for some reason, those annoying, 1/2 glass shower doors have migrated across the Atlantic and into American hotels. (Sofitel properties use them in Europe and now the Kimpton properties and Omni do in America!) These things DO NOT keep water off the floor and this creates not only a danger to you when you step out, but a massive flood that has got to be bad for the walls, the floors, and everything else that gets hit. It took 3 towels every morning just to soak up the mess. Talk about a colossal waste of resources--the water and the towels. Other than this daily annoyance, the bathroom was beautiful and had high end bath products--something I really appreciate. General Comments: Every time I called and asked for anything, the front desk was quick to take care of things for me. Taxis, requests for room cleaning, whatever. I appreciate the can-do attitude and the attention to the guest's needs. I loved my stay and cannot wait to return to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “quiet location off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: TeamBroBra_Intl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you are not in NOLA strictly to party. On a fairly quiet street and more of an older crowd at the hotel. A very nice hotel bar is across the street. Within close walking distance of the French Quarter and good restaurants on Tchopitoulas. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable rooms, good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: daveinmonument
Reviews.Content: We chose the Omni Royal Crescent for two reasons: (1) rating on Trip Advisor; and (2) price. We weren't disappointed. It isn't the fanciest of places. It has a small entry lobby. The elevators make a few disconcerting noises. But the staff were all friendly, efficient, and professional. The rooms (we had two) were comfortable with very good beds. And they were clean. It's on a quiet street but close to Canal Street and a pleasant walk to the French Quarter. It's only about two blocks from Mother's Restaurant on Poydras. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Nice Modern Version of an Omni”
Reviews.Author: Juan M
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this. Staff was great. Room rates were reasonable. Rooms and fitness center area were a little small, and the restaurant closed a little early. However I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent week-long stay!”
Reviews.Author: ds20e
Reviews.Content: The Omni Royal Crescent is an ideal place to stay in New Orleans. Although this is a boutique style hotel, the place offers lots of value. Rooms: The nicely decorated rooms have been renovated, featuring a large marble bathroom, flat screen TV, a safe for your valuables, a fridge, and plenty of lighting. Location: The hotel is located just two blocks away from the French quarter, yet is far enough away that it's peaceful late at night. I was in town for a conference so the Morial Convention Center was an easy 10-minute walk form the hotel. Amenities: The sixth floor has the a rooftop deck with wading pool, exercise room with TV, and sauna. Even two yoga mats were available. "Dress It" is the on site restaurant. They offer a breakfast buffet for $14.99. It may sound pricey but there was a vast selection of breakfast foods to suit any desire. Taxi Service: The hotel can make arrangements with a taxi company to take you to the airport once your stay has ended. Just let them know what time you require a taxi the night before. Cool hallways: Although not very necessary in March, I can see how having ultra cool hallways can be a relief in those humid summer months. Professional front desk staff: I found them to be very cordial and on the ball. I ran out of tissues and requested a new box, which arrived less than 5 minutes later. The staff wish you well when you leave for the day and welcome you back when you return: a very nice touch. Elevators: My room was on the sixth floor but the wait time was very short every time, even on checkout day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful upgrade due to reservation ambiguity”
Reviews.Author: painterhiker
Reviews.Content: Though I did not notice that our reservation only specified the number of adults (3), not the number of beds (2 that I had specified), the hotel did agree to upgrade us (for no extra cost) to a king suite because one room with one bed, with an additional cost for a rollaway was not acceptable to us. Not only was the suite quite spacious but housekeeping did a perfect job for the three days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: BR_Medic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for her birthday. We absolutely enjoyed it! The service was exceptionally well.Since I had joined their Select Member program when I made the reservation, we were upgraded to the Omni suite! The bed was comfortable and the views were amazing! The bathroom was marble and large enough for 2 people to get ready in. There is 1 and only 1 problem: there is a goofy glass half-door for the shower that doesn't keep much water in the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: superspy12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel back in December and have to say that it is a great hotel in a great location. It is in a quieter area of New Orleans but not a far walk from all the main attractions. The staff was very friendly at and greeted us each time we walked through the lobby. We were given a complimentary upgrade upon check-in and were surprised at the size of the room compared to other accommodations in New Orleans. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: reliv123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent. The location is great - 2 blocks to the French Quarter, but still quiet. The only complaint was the room's window faced a wall. However, this did make the room very quiet at night. What set the hotel apart was the service of the front desk - they truly wen out of their way to make our stay fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, but elegant service”
Reviews.Author: Globaldominator
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days following Mardi Gras 2011. The room was small but comfortable and cozy. The beverage service was excellent and the staff was courteous. The water pressure in the shower could scour your dirtiest dishes clean! I think the best part was the heated rooftop pool. The lookout point has the most amazing views of the city. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value....Good Location”
Reviews.Author: akakathleen
Reviews.Content: Great location! Just a few blocks in each direction from French Quarter, river front, casino, street cars, etc. Easy walk to wherever you want to go. Room was a little small but we didn't spend much time in room. Bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JFerguson
Reviews.Content: I travel all the time and this hotel was an oasis for a road warrior. Close enough to the French Quarter and downtown to walk (only a few blocks away). A block or two from the street car lines so you can get out to the neighborhoods. The rooms were fantastic, well appointed, and clean. Service at the Omni is always impeccable. I got a great deal on the Omni website for the room - $109/night a week before Mardi Gras. The restaurant is nothing to write home about, but the breakfast sandwich I ordered a la carte my last morning was fantastic ($6.50). A great restaurant called Luke is also just around the corner (have their own farm, local/organic). All around a great hotel in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “This was rated #1 ?????”
Reviews.Author: Bourdain
Reviews.Content: My sister and I came to visit New Orleans from 2/19 to 2/23. PROS: 1) Front desk staff was extremely courteous and professional. An error was made with our room request upon check-in and it was rectified in a timely manner with apologies. They greet the guests as they enter and exit the hotel. 2) Location was good - 2 or 3 blocks of walking distance to the French Quarter, away from party noises and the smelly streets of garbage! CONS: Housekeeping either needs to re-train their staff or hire new ones. 1) All the surfaces (end tables and writing desk) were covered in dust. My sister and I coughed and sneezed after we tried to wipe them down ourselves. 2) The carpet in our room was not thoroughly vaccuumed - we found cut toenails left by previous patrons near the bathroom entryway! GROSS! 3) Two days in a row - We left in the mornings to sightsee and we returned to find that housekeeping did not close our room door all the way. We came back to a hotel room with the door ajar! Fortunately nothing was stolen but it sure posed a compromise in security! 4) On our day of departure, we found housekeeping hidden around the corner texting on her cell phone . . . she should spend her work hours cleaning instead of socializing! 5) Ask for a room that is NOT FACING Gravier Street! There's a club/lounge next door and patrons liked to carry their partying onto the street. The first night we had a room facing the street and we could not sleep until 4 a.m.!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: EGAme
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and my 10 year anniversary trip. The customer service was impressive, especially considering I had read all of the good reviews. They even wrote a handwritten note thanking us for our stay. Would highly recommend also due to its location. It's 2 blocks from the French quarter which is far enough to avoid the noise. Definitely sign up for the "rewards" program as this gets you free wireless Internet and two free beverages each am at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SVO767
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a quick trip through the Gulf coast. The Omni Royal Crescent was a terrific value. We got a very clean, comfortable, and well decorated room in an excellent location. It was about a 2 block walk to Canal Street and after crossing Canal, you are right in the French Quarter. The hotel is about 7 stories tall, so not overly large. It has a very quaint and cozy feel to it. It's in an old building, as one would expect in New Orleans, but it's classy and has lots of charm. I would absolutely stay in this hotel in a heartbeat. The only down sides were a shower with half a door (yes it was designed this way), so water got everywhere in the bathroom; and a bed that sank in the middle. It was a little uncomfortable when trying to get settled for bed, but luckily I was exhausted during the trip so it didn't interfere with the quality of sleep that much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sunfish117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni during a conference and had a fantastic stay. The check-in was smooth and our room was ready right away. The beds and pillows were REALLY comfortable. One small draw back was that we requested a crib in the room, which made it quite cramped. The sundeck and hot tub on the 6th floor was small, but still a nice way to relax. The front desk staff were wonderful during our stay. They were cheerful, helpful and responsive to any questions we had. Plus, their restaurant recommendations were always good. Our favorite was the Ruby Slippers around the corner. I recommend joining "Omni Select Guest" as well: many perks including morning beverage, free WiFi, fast check-in and morning newspaper. And it's free! Overall, for the price, this hotel offers fantastic value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience at booking in”
Reviews.Author: js4
Reviews.Content: I travelled across the US last month with my husband and two young adult children and remain bemused by our experience at this hotel. All our accommodation was pre-booked for our party of 4 with two rooms: described as a double/deluxe for my husband and I and a twin for the other two. We stayed in five other cities and were always provided with appropriate accommodation (ie two beds in the room requested as a twin). That was except when we arrived at Omni Royal Crescent where we were informed by front desk staff that both rooms had one bed only, that there were no rooms available with two beds and that a rollaway could be provided at a cost to us of $30 per night. Having booked the accommodation 12 months in advance (!) and paid well in excess of $200 a night (for each rooom) we found this expectation unacceptable. The young man dealing with us kept repeating the phrase "I'm sorry for the misunderstanding" and offered some implausible explantion about 'twin' referring to the dimensions of the bed, the implication being that the misunderstanding was ours alone, despite the fact that all the other hotels we stayed at in the country understood twin to mean two . That was not my idea of the excellent customer service I had expected as an Omni Select guest. We did consider contacting the manager via his cell phone, (as others noted, this was provided after checking in) however we decided just to get out and enjoy New Olreans rather than spend further time and energy expressing our dissatisfaction. As it eventuated we were not charged the $30 rate, presumably because a more experienced staff member thought better of it, yet there was never an apology provided or gesture of compensation offered during our 5 night stay. Other reviewers have remarked that it was a quiet location yet the Saturday night we were there our sleep was disturbed until about 4am due to the street noise. Apart from that it was quite a nice hotel, but I felt sorry for the housekeeping staff having to mop up pools of water in the bathrooms each day.

Reviews.Title: “Many Better Options”
Reviews.Author: NIOCT11
Reviews.Content: I have used tripadvisor reviews to help me choose hotels in various cities, but will be more suspicious in future. I stayed in the Royal Omni Crescent for 6 nights to attend a local conference in February 2011 and it is average at best. It mistifies me how this hotel can be ranked No.1 in New Orleans on this site! The rooms are average, the breakfasts are poor, and the 'gym' consists of 3 running machines and a tiny outdoor pool. In terms of value, Id say its poor - I paid 220 dollars per night after tax without breakfast! The Hiton, Ritz, and Marriott, and Westin are pricier but worth it. The Iberville Suites are a bit of a gem as they are much cheaper and give you free access to the Ritz gym (the Ritz is in the same building as the Iberville). In other words, weigh up the alternatives closely before going for the Royal Omni Crescent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: GoldenVenissa
Reviews.Content: The Omni Crescent was the hotel I stayed at for my first trip to NOLA, and I made the decision based off of Trip Advisor. It was great! The room was clean, well equipped and modern. The bed was COMFY and the bathroom was large enough so we could both get ready at the same time. The location was great, off the French Quarter enough that it was quieter but it was never too far to get anymore. One word of caution, which applies to anywhere in New Orleans, I'd stay on the main streets when walking after dark. The burger restaurant in the lobby was never busy but the food was good. We stopped in there our first night in and the server was very helpful and friendly! Great food and the Albita beer was a good local beverage. I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: cjkWI
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the advice of other travelers on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. This is within walking distance to everything, museums, french quarter, and trolleys that will take you to other districts, the zoo etc... The room was spotless, updated decor, and friendly staff. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Struck Lucky”
Reviews.Author: Yarmas
Reviews.Content: Clearly a lot of choice of hotels in NOLA, but we struck lucky with this hotel. Good location. Extremely friendly staff. Very nice rooms. Would definitely stay here again. Cool roof-top pool and small but clean and modern gym.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: wheresheroams
Reviews.Content: The Omni Royal Crescent is a phenomenal place to stay in New Orleans. It is just outside the French Quarter, but close to Harrah's and the Riverwalk. To me the location was perfect. It was quiet at night and close to everything. The staff was amazing as well. Sarah and Mark were great! Thanks you two! I signed up for the Omni Select rewards card online and with it we got free beverages delivered first thing in the morning and free WiFi. What a treat! Also - we got an amazing deal on Expedia, so room rates were super reasonable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: apreskar
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to tripadvisor reviews! Wow, it was perfect. The staff, amazing! Anna, Ed, Mark all need huge raises! The location works out perfect to enjoy walks to and from French Quarter and close to Harrahs for a little gambling. We were upgraded to a suite without asking, received a kind hand written note welcoming us to the hotel, excellent and hearty breakfast delivered to our room, we will stay there again and again! Trying to figure out when we can go back again and visit this Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: khtrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011 for three nights. We arrived after midnight on the first night and the staff were very accommodating to the late arrival, and quick to check us in so we could get to our room and to sleep. The hotel location is fabulous -- two blocks outside the French Quarter so quiet enough to get a great night sleep but a very easy walk to everything. The room was a bit on the small side, but perfectly adequate, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were very responsive and quickly took care of anything we needed. The hotel has a small gym and rooftop jacuzzi. Highly recommended -- I would definitely stay here again if I return to New Orleans (and I hope to!)

Reviews.Title: “One of my Top Hotel Experiences Ever”
Reviews.Author: Faygelah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great, and the friendliness of the staff took it way over the top. Our room was a King non-smoking with a jacuzzi tub. When we checked in, the front desk staff was extremely helpful and welcoming. The guy practically insisted -- in a nice way -- on helping us with our bags. Later we realized that was the hotel manager! We were greeted with a personal hndwritten note welcoming us to the hotel from the General Manager, with his cell phone number, should we have any problem during the stay. Oyur room was spacious, with very high ceilings, on a quiet cul-de-sac of a hallway. Others have already commented on the weird set-up of the bathtub and shower. The shower points at the bathroom floor, just beyond the tub, so that if you don't close the curtains tightly, it's almost impossible not to wind up with water all over the floor. But, really, who cares? Love the red and green Mardi Gras beads they use for maid service and do not disturb door hangers. The elevators are small and sometimes take a while to come. I hate the water bottles and spray starch (!) that charge you if you use them, but that's just me. THe hotel is pretty old. Out of our window there was an ugly view of a light shaft, but we weren't looking out the window much. It would be nice if they had some afternoon cocktail hour (this is New Orleans, isn't it?). And ice is located on just a few floors, but the maid brought around ice every afternoon. (A really nice touch.) The place is almost perfectly situated for quiet and easy access to the Vieux Carre. The staff went way beyond what they needed to do to make us comfortable and to help us negotiate the neighborhood and the various tourist sites. I'd recommend this to anybody except for someone who wanted a very very fancy five-star hotel experience. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: bbl59
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The price was reasonable, the staff was extremely friendly and the beds and linens were unbelievably comfortable. The room also had a small refrigerator. The location allowed us easy walking access to the French Quarter, as well as the waterfront, and the streetcar lines. I would definitely stay here again. There was no business center, but we were able to use the computer and printer at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great deal on king jacuzzi suite”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference down the street at the Sheraton. After checking the conference rate at the Sheraton I looked online and found I could book the Omni king jacuzzi suite using the AAA rate for cheaper than the conference rate at the Sheraton. This was a refundable rate booked several months in advance. My room was a standard size king hotel room but the bathroom was larger and had a big jetted tub where a normal size bathtub would normally be. I used the tub three times during my two night stay. It was a deep tub with strong jets. There was an issue with the tub - basically whoever installed the plumbing fixtures picked the wrong ones because they did not fit the tub. The tub filler barely got the water into the tub it aimed more or less on the side of the tub. But an even bigger snafu was the shower above the tub. When the shower was turned on full blast, the water sprayed over the tub and out on to the floor rather than into the tub. Rather than having the shower fixture on the side, it was centered on the wall facing out from the tub. There was a shower curtain on rings on one of those poles hanging from the ceiling. One had to keep the shower curtain completely closed in order to keep the water from ending up on the floor. Fortunately there was a drain on the floor right where the shower water would hit the floor. I wonder if it had to be put in after the bad plumbing job or if it was already there. Given all the fresh towels the shower snafu was a minor annoyance compared to the large tub. My bed was very comfortable and the room was recently renovated with clean and up dated carpet and furniture. The room faced into a side wall so no street noise. The door was not hung all that well and there were gaps around the door which meant more hallway noise despite being at the end of a cul de sac. I sometimes wore earplugs so as not to hear the halway noise. One nice touch was the free delivery int he morning of two beverages of choice - for frequent hotel stay members. I ordered room service once it was fine. The restaurant is not fancy it is a gourmet sandwich shop. I would have prefered a more tranditional restaurant and room service menu but at least the prices were reasonable and the quality of food good. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. High quality and good selection. It costs about $16. The woman working the bar at night was very friendly. She offered me specials like a 2-1 during happy hour wiht the second well after the happy hour. She also had some suggestions for what I could order that was not a sandwich sort of slightly off the menu. Overall the staff was excellent. My room came with two robes. There were really nice high end robes with terry on one side and smooth material on the other. I used the gym twice it is tucked away behind the pool/jacuzzi on the sixth floor roof. You go outside and then through another door into a smallish gym area. The Gym had some cardio equipment and separate mens/womens saunas. There was a TV and a keg of ice water. I used the elliptical it was in good working order. The gym smells somewhat of mildew it was the only mildew smell I noticed at this property which is pretty good for New Orleans where mildew seems to permeate almost everything. My rate for the king jacuzzi suite was $162/night plus tax. I was quite satisfied with this given that the conference rate at the sheraton was closer to $200. The restuarant turned out to be a great place to work in the evening. Plenty of table space, well lit and free wifi. I would stay here again in the same suite.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Royal Crescent is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paulblum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 blocks from the French Quarter. That makes it an easy walk to the Quarter without the noise and priciness the quarter brings with it. Rooms were well designed and clean. The staff was great. The price was great. I can't think of a single negative comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, quiet, very soft bed.”
Reviews.Author: ms9
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from the french quarter. Quiet, but near everything. No business center but they will let you print your boarding passes. Take the E2 shuttle from the airport during the week and arrive 7 blocks away from here for only $2! If you like very soft beds and squishy pillows, you are in luck! I didn't sleep very well, but thats not the hotel's fault. Staff is very polite, enthusiastic.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Tedsfriedclams
Reviews.Content: Front desk people were just amazing, at your beck and call. We had the adjoining rooms, very nice, but you should be aware at booking that adjoining rooms don't have any windows! Different, but we got used to it. Front desk people are what made the hotel special.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LCFTAK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definetly the only place I will ever stay at in New Orleans! I booked through a bidding website so you never know what to expect. When we arrived we were greeted by the friendliest people and given a HUGE corner room with floor to ceiling windows that overlooked downtown. All the furnishings were luxurious and the bed was so comfortable I never wanted to move! The bathroom was large with robes and nice soaps. The room also had a flat screen TV. One night I had a few medical issues and the staff went above and beyond helping me out. This hotel is in the perfect location. It is two streets over from the french quarter, two streets up from the river area(casino) and two streets down from the St Charles Streetcar. Nothing is more than a 4-5 minute walk away. It is also quiet so you can get some sleep. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who asks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: se123Minneapolis
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Stayed with a group of girlfriends over Thanksgiving. Rooms are small but you don't feel confined and the beds are comfortable enough. It's far enough away from Bourbon St. if you want something a little more quiet but close enough to still walk to all the action. They had a great bartender in the Touche lounge that made our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dahacker
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with my three night stay here. Its a quick walk to the meat of Bourbon street, but out of the craziness. So you can party in the French Quarter and then rest your bones afterward in peace and quiet. The hotel is also just two blocks from the St Charles street and Canal Street streetcars. We actually stayed on the eighth floor where the rooms have very high ceilings. The HVAC controls were awesome and quiet. How many hotels have you been in where the freaking AC is loud? Flat screen HDTV was nice, but I'm still looking for the Holy Grail of actually finding HD programming in a Hotel. We weren't there to watch TV, so I didn't care. Bathroom was beautiful, but one nit....the shower glass only covered half the shower so invariably there was water on the floor. The bed and linen looked great, but the bed oddly sloped to the middle. They just need some slightly firmer mattresses. As an Omni select member (sign up for free) we got two free beverages each delivered to us in the morning. Normally I would say who cares, but after partying every night in this town, you need some serious hydration. There was a city wide water pressure problem our first night. We returned to the hotel and the water didn't work in the toilet, sink, or shower. It worked the following morning, but the city had a boil drinking water warning for the entire next day and a half. The water problem was not the hotels fault and probably effected every hotel in the city. The hotel supplied lots of bottled drinking water for us upon request. The open sky Jacuzzi pool on the 6th floor was a great surprise and the wife and I were able to hit it in private! Wifi was free for Omni Select members too. On the eighth floor Verizon 3G was three times faster than the hotel Wifi. Yeah, I measured it. I would stay here again at some point after I sober up from the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: nolazona
Reviews.Content: I logged on to this site to warn others about my nightmare stay at the Ambassador, but figured that I should also write up the good - which is this hotel. I travel to New Orleans a lot, as I used to live there and it is one of my favorite cities, and for the value - this is my favorite hotel. The staff went above and beyond (going through the trash for me after I realized I'd left a (full) shopping bag after checkout) and the room was beautiful and quiet. This is nothing flashy like the W, or Le Pavillon etc. but it is a quiet, safe, comfortable, and really pretty hotel with a wonderful staff. Book early - unforthnately it was booked up for my last trip and I was sorely disappointed with where we ended up staying. Omni Royal Crescent is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Bubsta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I eloped to New Orleans at the end of August and loved our stay at the Omni Royal Crescent. The hotel is unique and charming and the staff unbelievably pleasant and helpful. Our bathtub drain didn't work on our first morning there but after a call to guest services, it was fixed within ten minutes. The location is perfect, a short (sobering) walk to and from the French Quarter, while providing for quiet nights. Having traveled extensively throughout my life, I have to say that this hotel stands out as one of my all time favorites. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Strange and yet Lovely”
Reviews.Author: EvelynC547
Reviews.Content: It has taken me a moment to write this review because I had mixed feelings. On the one hand there were so many things I loved but.... Overall though, from the personal note found in the room, to the check out I felt that they were really trying. First, apart of it was my fault, I planned the 7 day stay during a weekend the Falcons played the Saints -poor timing.
