Also I was with my daughter, so I required a sleeping arrangement that isn't condusive to their set up, which seems ideal for singles or couples but not two people who don't want to sleep in same bed, and one of them needs a desk. They have this interesting adjoining room set up that is perfect, but during my stay (timing) the few rooms they had like that were booked, so I had to move three times (my choice) However, the first two times I moved the staff made no offer to help, the third time they did. The last move I had to wait until after 3pm and even after that I had to wait in a different room, which caused a major problem later with the internet connection. Also, the double room I was finally in had no running cold water (they did compensate) Overall I felt the staff really tries to make it work. They are cordial and maintained professionalism throughout. Folk have already mentioned the showers, now that is weird on so many levels... when I got into the fully glassed in shower (one of adjoining rms) I found that if I didn't want to wash my hair it wouldn't work for me-at 5'6" the showerhead is directly over your head and has almost no range to move...and then there was the half glass that is just messy. Both of these bathroom issues are solvable 1) Put flexible hose showerhead 2) Add shower curtain inside half glass. Even though no pool and I don't do public hot tubs I found the patio comfortable/relaxing and my daughter did too. To me this hotel works best for couples and singles. Oh wait, the bathrobes are not the same in all rooms, but the ones with terry cloth and silky cotton outside are fantastic (Waldorf quality) and unlike many hotels they are size Large, so roomy. You have to get used to the resturant-it took me a minute. The grits dish and the poorboy shrimp, fantastic. The waitresses are great too.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale boutique at a moderate chain hotel price”
Reviews.Author: susang73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five days at the Omni Royal Crescent while attending a conference a few blocks away at the Riverside Hilton. I'm so glad I opted out of the conference hotel for this cozy boutique on a quiet sidestreet, just a few blocks from the French Quarter. In addition, by staying at the Omni for about $130/night including tax, I saved my employer well over $600. I agree with other reviewers who praised the location, service, comfort, and decor. I also agree that the shower is a bit strange, the pool is tiny, there are no vending machines or business center, but none of these are dealbreakers to me. While the complimentary morning coffee delivered to the room is nice (for frequent guest program members), a light continental breakfast would be even nicer! This hotel has a hip European vibe to it; it's best for independent types and probably not suited for families or high maintenance people. As a woman travelling alone I felt comfortable in the neighborhood, even at night (not so in the French Quarter) and there are lots of small local cafes nearby, including a great Thai restaurant if you ever tire of the creole/cajun cuisine. Parking can be found for $15/day at a surface lot two blocks away -- this is a steal by New Orleans. standards.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: bernieb77
Reviews.Content: From the first minute we arrived at the Omni Royal Cresent we were made to feel very welcome and our stay was perfect. The room was spaciuos, lovely bathroom, huge bed, coffee machine, safe and fridge. The food in the restaurant was exellent and really reasonably priced. The location was very good, everything was in walking distance. The staff are fantastic always welcoming, polite and friendly the room was cleaned everyday to a high standard. The hot tub in the roof terrace is great although it was a bit hot when we stayed to use it more often, we were waiting for a cool evening to make the most of it but we didn't get one. We hope to return to New Orleans and would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jonofoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights & loved it. Great location, being close enough to walk to everything but far enough away to be quite. Staff are excellent, the general manager is a great guy & loved by his people, all of whom seem to love working here. Our room was on the top floor & was excellent, I'm an ex international flight attendant, so have stayed in Hotels on every continent, this is one of the best

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: edj206
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay. staff was wonderful. anything we needed was taken care of promptly .beds are great. easy walk to french quarter. breakfast at resturaunt was good & waitress was very nice & helpful with our questions about the city. we will probably stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “fantasic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctbobnm
Reviews.Content: great hotel perfect location 5 min walk to french quater,casino,and river walk rooms was great service was outstanding great little sun deck area to chill out in

Reviews.Title: “Good value but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: mholly99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are currently staying at the Omni Royal Crescent (3rd night and 2nd full day). The hotel has a very good location as it is only a few blocks from the French Quarter and close to several restaurants. Also, the bed is extremely comfortable, and the rate that we are paying for the room is very reasonable. That being said, I am not sure how this hotel is ranked as high as it. The service and bathroom is horrible, the internet service is spotty, and the street noise makes sleeping difficult. We stayed at the Omni in Chicago four months ago and had a wonderful experience. We honestly felt taken care of and that is what I am comparing our current experience to. If you get a good rate at this hotel and are not expecting a high level of customer service, you will be pleased with the experience. On the first day of our stay, we returned to our room to find that all of our drinking glasses and ice bag were removed and not replaced. Trip #1 to the front desk. Our keys did not work when we returned back to the hotel on the second day. Trip #2 to the front desk. We then realized that they took our ice bag again and did not replace it. Trip #3 to the front desk. We just returned from dinner on the same day (after 2 trips to the front desk), and realized that they only replaced half of our wash cloths. The ceiling in the bathroom looks like it could cave in and the knob that controls the water in the shower is literally not attached to the fixture. We quickly learned to turn and not pull! We are staying on the 6th floor (out of 8), and the street noise is very noticeable. The windows look extremely old and thin. This is obviously not the hotel's fault, but it did magnify the situation. We were woken up the first morning by a jackhammer. When we left that morning, we realized that the jackhammer was being used to repair the street two feet outside the front door of the hotel. There was no explanation or apology from the staff. As I previously said, the bed and location are nice, but if you are expecting an "Omni" experience, you should probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Who dat don't's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed, excited at firstbut after the first night street repairs with the sound of jack hammer and back up alarms until 0300 in the morning. The next day we requested a room change however they only had rooms on lower floors same side. The second night speaker noise coming from the restaurant on first floor plus street noise was bad, we were on the third floor. The glass in the rooms need to be noise reducing. The hotel had no vending or complimentary computer so if you wanted to eat you had to go to bar, service not the best, you can tell this is a major tourist city, will be a long time before we go again, did I mention that there are fees for everything!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “About the best in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mtlines
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to New Orleans for the past 5 years (our son was a Katrina freshman at Tulane). We have stayed at most of the 4 star hotels in the City during this time and this was the best value for the money and one of the most pleasant stays. The room was spacious, the bed was almost as wonderful as ours at home, the shower was great and the staff were so friendly and helpful. By joining the select guest program on the internet we had a pot of coffee in the morning and a bottle of water at night and free internet. The location is great as you can walk to Canal and Bourbon Street and also to Poydras and the business district yet it was easy for us to be picked up. The traffic was not as bad as in the French Quarter. The bar was great to relax and the bartender was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kekbaldw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - clean rooms, helpful staff, good location. Its not IN the french quarter, but just a block and half from Canal Street (and realistically, if you're drinking on Bourbon Street, a short walk would likely do you good ...). i've stayed in hotels in the French Quarter before ... and they're either VERY sketchy or super expensive (in some cases both). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: RonF3
Reviews.Content: Hospitable staff, clean, rooms a little small, but quaint

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara_johnson97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, far enough away from the French Quarter but still close to walk. The hotel was nice and very clean. The staff was great. I do have one complaint, you have to hang beads on the door if you want your room cleaned and no one informed us of that, I think the idea is great but annoying if you did want your room cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from Canal and that can be a good thing to get away from the sights and smells of the French Quarter. It is also in a good location if you are going to the convention center, the casino and the museums on Camp Street. Before we checked in the contacted us to see if we wanted bigger room or a room with a view. We chose a bigger room and the view was of a cinder block wall three feet away. Just be aware of this, if views are important to you. The restaurant and bar aren't anything special, but it's New Orleans and everything you need is right outside the door. This is good hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramblinwreck59
Reviews.Content: This hotel just blocks from the French Quarter exceeded our expectations. The staff was very professional and made us feel at home. The rooms were clean, neat and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Omni - wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: qcgirl
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews have mentioned the hotel has a great location (close to Canal St. and the French Quarter). Check in/out was quick and the room was clean. However, the staff at the hotel definitely made a difference with my stay. Everyone we encountered was extremely friendly, helpful, and professional. The staff seemed to go an extra mile to ensure we had a great stay. When the staff saw that we had a child with us they made sure he received an Omni kids pack. Upon entering our room we found a handwritten note to us from the manager of the hotel welcoming us. The daily complimentary beverages and ice delivery to the room was an another bonus. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/ Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: 212Travel
Reviews.Content: The Omni Royal Crescent in New Orleans is just 2 blocks away from Canal Street and Charles St where you can jump on the streetcar if you wish to go to the garden district. Its a nice boutique hotel two blocks away from the French Quarters and not to be mistaken with the Omni Royal Hotel - a four diamond luxury hotel inside the French Quarters. Our taxi driver dropped us off at the wrong Omni Hotel! Once we arrived at the right hotel, the front desk gave us two free breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience. The customer service is great and the rooms are very clean and a nice size. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: 1goirish
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute as i had to extend my stay in New Orleans. A friend recommended the Omni Royal Crescent and with good reason. Check in was smooth and the room was nice and large with a good sized bathroom. The walls were thin, but that kind of thing rarely bothers me. The lobby area is very small and the hotel bar was tiny...but it had cold beer and a friendly bartender, which is all that really matters. The rate was excellent booked on the omni website an hour before check-in. It is also a short walk to the French Quarter or the casino, if that interests you. All in all, I would recommend the Omni Royal Crescent to anybody wanting to stay at a good quality hotel for the right price in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good food, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Jdubj
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. The hotel and waitstaff were excellent. The food from the restaurant was inexpensive and taste GREAT. Location is good close to Harrah's and the French Quarter, but far enough away that you don't have too much late night noise. Walls were thin, I could hear the people in the rooms next to me and the hallway. We stayed in the "jacuzzi suite", it was more like a standard bathtub with jets. That jacuzzi is Ok for one regular size person, but I'm 6' 5 so I didnt fit in it. Next time we come back to New Orleans we probably will stay again, but not in a jacuzzi room.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place, and I think there was a ghost in the room too- fun!”
Reviews.Author: rollinthroughSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel and enjoyed all the facilities had to offer- I am definitely recommending it to friends. I was able to use the gym and pool late night and the bar was open at a decent hour too. It was a short and interesting walk to where the shopping and entertainment areas were- we had coffee and beignets in hand from Cafe Beignet in about 15 mins. The art district neighborhood has that New Orleans feel to it which is why we visited the town in the first place. I feel strongly that around 3:30am I woke up to a real creepy feeling that may have been imagined but I really don't think so. Well if I did wake up to a ghost in New Orleans then I feel I truly got all that town had to offer then! I'm looking forward to my next stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the good reviews were accurate.”
Reviews.Author: coldsprings1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights, at a great special rate, where the third night was free. This made the room very, very reasonable. Very quiet and comfortable. The half glass door for the shower left a lot of water on the floor, more of a problem for the maid than for the guest. The only thing lacking was a soda machine. I mentioned this when we checked out and the front desk clerk said we should have called and they would have gotten a coke for us. The two free beverages per person in the morning was great, also the bathrobes. Be sure to sign up for the rewards card to get the free morning beverage and your choice of newspaper and to customize what kind of pillows etc you want. This was our first stay at an Omni but won't be the last. Location is two blocks from Canal St and the Canal and St Charles trolleys, where we used a VisiPass, a bargain at $12 for three days unlimited rides.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for your Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: jadeyes78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Omni Royal Crescent, New Orleans for our honeymoon out of dozens of hotels. Our decision was not in vain. We arrived at 3am only to find someone immediately on-hand to take care of our bags, and to find out that we'd already been checked in. (Hassle free!!) Our room was immaculate, bed turned down, and everything that was guaranteed was there! The jacuzzi was a wonderful asset along with the plasma TV and more than comfortable King bed. Every morning we were treated to two complimentary beverages of our choice EACH (and they brought the whole coffee pot!!). The staff was among the friendliest I've seen and were always available. The bed was turned down each evening, toiletries refilled, and room back to pristine condition. The day of our check out they completed our stay hassle-free yet again by simply slipping our bill under our door. All we needed to do was ask them to bring the car to the front door (they provide valet parking for a reasonable daily fee.) We would definitely stay here again!! Make sure and become a member on their website or over the phone when you reserve to receive the complimentary items! It's a FREE membership!!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Royal Crescent - Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Majestyk007
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because I was traveling on business and leisure and it is located between the French Quarter and the Morial Convention Center. Only 4 blocks from Canal and Bourbon. The staff were excellent. When I checked in I did not have a desk in my room on which to work. The staff moved me to a larger room with a desk. The hotel is beautiful with high ceilings in the rooms. We stayed 3 nights and selected the "Linger Longer" rate... 3rd night free! Only annoying part was the internet router on our floor was flaky and did not offer consistent connections. Assuming they fix that, I would select this hotel next time I visi NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “So much more for so much less...”
Reviews.Author: ryanpm
Reviews.Content: This is a very impressive hotel. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I usually have something to complain about after a stay at a hotel (however minor), but not this time. We will definitely look to the Omni Royal Crescent when/if we plan another trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel was icing on our great vacation.”
Reviews.Author: dahlin43
Reviews.Content: I recommend when you book a room with Omni, to sign up for their Select Members program. When we walked in around 1pm, we didn't even have to ask if we can check in early. She had everything ready and prepared. Very friendly. The room was great, a little small, but enough room for my bf and me and our bags. The bathroom was great except for the half glass door. That looked great but very impractical. The room was clean and it was cleaned daily. The view was okay. They use feather pillows, which my bf is not fond of, so they were quick to bring him foam pillows after he called. Then an hour later, the front desk called to make sure we got the pillows. I really liked the follow through with the service. My biggest disappointment was the "pool" was not a pool but a hot tub. There is no need for a hot tub on a day where the heat index was 100 degrees. But they did say we had rights at their sister property in the French Quarter. The location of this hotel was very central to the FQ, CBD, and Garden District. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: xuxuNewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. I was with my husband and my 1 1/2 year old daughter and it was excellent! The staff is very helpful and the hotel is clean and quiet with a short walk to the French quarter. It is easy to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: FC1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent this past weekend for the Memorial Day holiday. The staff was extremely welcoming from the moment we walked in, and were more than happy to answer any questions and provide tips on where to go to eat, etc. I was quite impressed with the rooms. I don't usually pay that much attention to decor, but I loved the way the rooms and bathroom were decorated, giving them a romantic feel. The room was quite big, for us anyway, and especially for the great price of approx $70 (through expedia). I paid more the previous night at another hotel, with the rooms being much smaller and service not so great. The only minor complaint I had is the same as mentioned in a previous review - the shower has some sort of half glass door, and water gets all over the floor. Also, the hallways were extremely cold, so maybe the A/C could be taken down a notch. However, not a big deal at all, considering the fantastic deal we got for such a great hotel. Also, as a tip to fellow travelers, if you need to park your car, just go down a couple blocks where you can pay $15 overnight. Ask the concierge and he will point you in the right direction. One more tip is to join the Omni Select Guest program, and you will receive free wireless internet in your room. Simply go to the website, and sign up there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great staff and a value for the location”
Reviews.Author: adrd
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Omni Royal Crescent after spending the first part of our trip at the Hilton New Orleans Riverside. This was a planned move after spending the first few days at the Hilton for business. We switched to the Omni since it had a better location and better prices. I was nothing but pleased, after receiving a rash from the Hilton bedsheets, and basically was very excited to try out this hotel. The Royal Crescent had an excellent staff, all were very welcoming, eager to help us get a cab or figure out where we were going, and the rooms were very clean. We made it down to breakfast once of the few days we were there and the buffet was great. For the same price as an omelet up the street they offered eggs, bacon, sausage; bagels and breads, muffins and croissants; several types of juice and coffee, a variety of meats and cheeses and more (around $12). We requested a few extra towels and they were brought up immediately. The room was large and spacious with a big closet. It was on the street side but we managed to sleep through any major street noises, nothing noticeable since the hotel is located on a side street. It was a short walk and easy access to Bourbon and the French Quarter. The riverfront was a few more blocks away. The fitness center was on the rooftop, where there was a small pool/hot tub and a beautiful large sun deck for tanning. The fitness center offered several treadmills and other equipment and was empty every time I used it. My only complaint about the hotel was the half-shower glass curtain, which at times made for more spray on the floor than in the tub, but with a few extra towels on the floor this wasn't really an issue. I thought that this was an excellent hotel for the price, and would stay again in a flash. They were the only hotel in the area that didn't jack up the prices on the weekends, and offered the triple A discount. The small hotel feel was a welcome change from the huge Hilton, and we definitely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: TBATES8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May for 3 nights. THe omni is great, clean, and the rooms are updated. The bed was comfortable. THe only complaint i have is how thin the walls are, we could here the girls conversations in the room next to us, and when they came in at 4 am and 5 am, banging around and talking, it woke us up! Either then that, the hotel is great, only a 2 minute walk to Canal street, and about a 5 - 10 minute walk to the French Quarter! Its far enough away but also close enough. We ate breakfast at their restuarant Dress It, its buffet style, and had great selection, it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: TnPuddy
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was wonderful...room was clean & smelled fresh...bed was comfy...bathroom was roomy...we loved the sundeck..we had breakfast at Dress It...it was fair...valet was a lil slow one day, but the next day they were right on it....great location for the trolley and a nice walk to Bourbon Street...a lil pricey, but we got a great deal through Travelocity.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Close to Quarter Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: canucks16
Reviews.Content: It was good to have a hotel 3 blocks from the French Quarter. We stayed in the Quarter our last visit to New Orleans and this was much better. Much quieter than the Quarter, but an easy walk to the Quarter. Nice Rooms. Very helpful front desk staff. Would stay here again One thing to note - the swimming pool on the roof isn't really a pool, it is a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel that gets the basics right”
Reviews.Author: BrianOSuilleabhain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The hotel is very clean, staff are generally helpful, it is quiet at night and is generally a good hotel to stay in. Although not technically in the french quarter it only takes around five or ten minutes to walk to bourbon street. The hotel is located on a quiet side street, yet is only five minutes walk from bustling canal street with all of its bars and restaurants; once you cross over canal street you are in the french quarter. We parked our car two blocks away on magazine street for $15 per 24 hours, which is a competitive rate in central new orleans. We always felt safe walking from the hotel to the french quarter even after dark. We didn't use the hotel restaurant so cannot comment on that although it always looked empty every time we passed it. We did try the outdoor hot tub but left quickly because it is not all that well set up, perched on a ledge on the hotel roof. The one small complaint I would make is that they don't provide a dedicated guest computer with internet access; instead they will let you use a staff computer at reception but obviously only for a short time. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a relaxing city break in new orleans with the opportunity to sleep soundly and do lots of sight seeing by day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: JSTravellerUsa
Reviews.Content: My family of ten travelled to New Orleans for my wedding over Easter weekend. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Omni Crescent. The staff were friendly, courteous, and helpful, especially when my fiance and I needed computer and printer access for marriage license info. They added a baby crib to my brother-in-laws room for his 1 year old, also. The roof-top hot tub and fitness center was great. We enjoyed lounging there, though the hot tub was HOT! The bathrooms in our rooms were huge. Overall, it was a wonderful experience. The one problem we had was getting our cars from valet parking. I think the valets had a problem with the elevator in the parking deck at one point and were very busy because of the Crescent City Classic on Saturday. Luckily, the hotel is close enough to everything in the quarter to walk to. Stay here! It is a hidden gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend Getaway! RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeof4
Reviews.Content: I visited the Omni Royal Crescent for my Birthday which was on Easter Weekend. Upon arrival, the staff was very pleasant and professional, I received a hand written card from the manager of the hotel welcoming my stay and thanking me for choosing the Omni Royal Crescent, out of all the hotels I've stayed in, I have NEVER gotten such a nice jester/greeting as this, I thought it was very personable and it made a lasting impression with me. The hotel is in EXCELLENT location, short walk to EVERYTHING and away from the noise on Bourbon St. for a good nights rest. The rooms are on the small side, but yet they were comfortable(especially the beds). The lobby was nice and clean. The only recommendations I would have for the hotel (to change) is to do some updating within the hotel such as rooms and hallways, and I think the bar should stay open later then what it does, to accommodate the late nighter's and fix the sidewalk outside of the hotel, outside of those things, you will not be disappointed and I would stay again upon returning to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for New Orleans Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Daquido_Bazzini
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited New Orleans over Easter weekend from Los Angeles. We are a member of OMNI (which is easy to register and become). We got a free soft drink of choice in the morning, and free internet service. I have to say the location is really good. It is so easy to walk to the various hot spots in the French Quarter. We had considered the other Omni Hotel near Bourbon Street, but we are glad we chose this one instead. Though I wouldn't rate this hotel up with the looks of some other Omni Hotels I have stayed at, it is still very nice and very clean. The Wi-Fi is a bit questionable at times. The value is definitely good, as we got a great rate for the long weekend. The staff is very nice and helpful. They also can help you to arrange a TAXI to the airport. We came back late the night before check out, and happened to ask them how long it would take a TAXI to get to the airport in the morning. They told us 20 minutes and offered to schedule a TAXI for us. The next morning, the TAXI arrived right on the dot timewise, and it indeed took 20 minutes. Overall, we like this place. The location is very close the Mississippi River, and all great bars & restaurants of New Orleans. It would be hard to find something better in all aspects. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. Excellent location. Could use updating”
Reviews.Author: rer1234
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded at no extra charge so i'm a litle biased, but generally the hotel is very good. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms nice. Bed and pillows were really comfortable. Hotel could use some updating. Our room was very nice, but the carpet in the hallway and the elevators (for example) should be updated. You really can't beat the location. In the middle of the french quarter, but still quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ATAYLOR912
Reviews.Content: Staff was fabulous! Hotel beautiful and very clean. Location could not have been better. Just few blocks away from the quarter and quiet at night and we felt very safe as well! Will def. stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: savannahc5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our way to Biloxi and decided to go the extra hour on to New Orleans for a quick trip- I am a planner who researches hotels and was a little nervous to just book this one on the way there on my Iphone! I always check with the travelers photos on tripadvisor cause they always show the truth of what the place really looks like-- The Omni Royal Cresent did not disappoint. I was pleased from the person who took my "last minute" reservation on the phone to when we arrived at check in and was helped by two of the nicest gentleman--- I was very happy with the room it was on the corner so a bit small, but the furnishings were tremendous- beautiful bed, luxurious drapes, flat screen, large windows, marble bathroom with great toiletries- You will love it here- there is a rooftop area that has very sheek furniture great for lounging! there is a gym and sauna up there and a hot tub- The hotel is very close to the french quarter, riverwalk and harrahs casino- we felt safe at night walking from our hotel and when we came in at night the desk clerk always smiled and spoke to us! In fact, we stayed an extra night cause we had such a great time and they so nicely worked with us on the rate for sunday night- She even gave us a room on a higher floor with panaramic views for the 2nd night- The staff is all about pleasing the traveler! Put your mind at ease after booking here- you will be very happy!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL -STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: travelermia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in early March. This is a small but beautiful hotel with the friendliest staff I have ever encountered anywhere. The room is wonderful with a comfortable bed. The hotel was completely booked but extremely quite. The bathroom is clean with great towels and toilettries. DO NOT EVEN CONSIDER THE REVIEWS THAT GAVE THIS HOTEL POOR AND TERRIBLE REVIEWS! They must have stayed at another hotel or have some serious issues totally unrelated to their stay here. This is the 10th different hotel I've stayed in while in NOLA, and I must say that this hotel ranks with the Roosevelt and Hilton Riverside as one of my favorites. It is absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Value Ideal for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Peaceful_Rhino
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to New Orleans for either business or pleasure and my first stay at the Omni Royal Crescent. If I had to return to New Orleans I would stay here in a heartbeat. First, I think I got the best pricing of any traveler for a king size roomâ€¦well below $100/nightâ€¦it was a momentary blip on their pricing radar screen as even the staff was amazed at the rateâ€¦but the price only made a great hotel even that much better. The staff was amazingly friendly, helpful and courteousâ€¦always with a smile. Because of the great rates, especially compared to those of the convention I was attending, my entire office booked there and the management went above and beyond to assist our group. When our team leader sent flowers to one of our office members ahead of time to congratulate him on a job well done, the staff rejected the order when delivered because the flowers were sub-par/drooping and arranged to have a new order placedâ€¦now thatâ€™s attention to detail. The rooms ranged from compact to really big. While I had one of the compact rooms, it was large enough to have decent walking space around the king bed and the extra high ceilings added to the comfort. While I have read some reviews about street noise, I did not have all that much and I was on the second floorâ€¦I think the rooms on Camp St. may get it worse than the ones on Gravier St. The bathroom was a decent size and adequate but I did have one of the remaining rooms with the half glass shower door. Having lived in Europe for a number of years, I became adept at managing to shower with this type of arrangement so it was not a problem but if youâ€™ve never dealt with these before it can be tricky especially since the shower head has limited range of motion. The only complaints, if thatâ€™s what they are, is that the bathroom tub was a little damaged on the porcelain and the toilet has an infrequent yet annoying habit of flushing itself/running periodically. The best deal is joining the FREE Omni club for the beverage service and free wi-fiâ€¦a stellar value for 3 minutes of signing up time. Beware, the beverage delivery folks may not always knock and let you know itâ€™s waiting outside so you may need to check. While I did not use the gym, I did check it out and it looked basic but the pool area is more of a glorified hot tub. I guess it serves a purpose for cooling off rather than doing laps. The best deal was the continental breakfastâ€¦which we were expecting to be boring but had a good array of meats, dairy, carbs and lots of â€œtake withâ€� items like breakfast bars, apples, etc. The location is idealâ€¦tucked on a side street close to the French Quarter but far enough away from the insanity. The location was great for the convention centerâ€¦a healthy 10-15 minute walk but even better for the French Quarter, post-convention activities which started only 2 blocks away. I would stay at the Omni Royal Crescent anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Classy with the best price/value ratio in the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Aristotelian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent Hotel for a conference. I found it after research on expedia and tripadvisor. The hotel has a great location and is likely the best price/value deal downtown. It is close to major conference venues and good restautants. However what the hotel offers doesn't look cheap either, as it has hints of up-market feel. My room was quite stately with a great bed and elegant interior decoration. For example, the bathroom was done in marble. The hotel is ranked 3 1/2 stars but it feels like a solid 4 stars. The only weakness is that breakfast is not included. Also the instructions regarding free WIFI need to be clearer vis-a-vis your registration on the Select Guest program. But on the whole this hotel is a great find and stay. Would definitely used it again if back in New Orleans and would recommend it to friends. It is a classy place to stay at an affordable price for downtown New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with fantastic value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Critical_Mind
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in a double bed room. Very nice room with excellent facilities for a hotel that is not a five star property. All in all I would say that the quality of the room compares to any good Hyatt/Fairmont hotel, but the hotel itself is 3 1/2 to 4 star simply because it does not offer things like shoeshine and extras like that. However, it did the job perfectly fine for us and it was actually incredible value for money. Very nice and clean marble bathroom with good amenities. Same applies to the bedroom. Very comfortable beds with goose down duvets and nice pillows. Very large flat-panel TV. Nice ambience. Breakfast for USD10.95 was very good and covered all the basics for a buffet. Again, very good value for money. All in all, this hotel ticked all the boxes for me. It has a good location and very good rooms. It really is a top pick in New Orleans since it is close to the French Quarter, but not in it (so you can get a good night rest), but it is likewise in easy reach to CBD. For the price you pay, it is stunning value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Marthtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Omni Royal Crescent this past weekend. The Hotel and the staff were great. Great location everything was only a few blocks away. Everyone was very helpful. The room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful and amazing people on staff”
Reviews.Author: ggdanisavage
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful facility. The rooms, lobby, resturant. They are cleanand well appointed. The staff here is top notch. They will take care of your needs with a friendly smile and a great attitude. Layla in the bar is a true gem. Great location. Close to everything yet still quiet and serene. The mattress was a bit rough.Big dip in the middle. It seemed more aged than the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mh_ct
Reviews.Content: Great value for money!! Its located couple of blocks outside the French quarter but everything is within walking distance!! Friendly and helpful staff; we had forgotten to bring printouts of our tickets for a concert and the staff printed off a copy for us. Very pleased with our stay there. Decent sized room, very spacious and large bathroom. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary getaway”
Reviews.Author: TZBCape
Reviews.Content: I always check tripadvisor.com before selecting a hotel for our family vacations. When my husband said he wanted to go somewhere for our anniversary, I chose a location and researched prices on other websites before checking the reviews on this site. I was a little worried after seeing so many contradictory reviews, but I noticed that the manager of this property always responded to complaints promptly and with courtesy. This impressed me and demonstrated the manager cared about his/her guests' experience, and that is what convinced me to choose the Omni Royal Crescent. We were not disappointed. The staff was wonderful, and they made check-in painless, even though we arrived right around 3:30 p.m. We didn't have a great view, but then again, that wasn't the reason why I chose the hotel. Much more important was the fact that Harrah's casino was a two-block walk from the hotel, and Bourbon Street was a mere three blocks in the opposite direction. We walked to Jackson Square, the Riverwalk Mall, and saw everything in between without much exertion at all. I used the workout facility and was impressed with the quality of the elliptical machines and treadmills. There was even a sauna! However, I was disappointed that there wasn't a hot tub on the roof/deck area, and the pool wasn't heated so that was not available to us since it was cold during our visit. I definitely echo the other folks who suggested becoming an Omni preferred member so you can get the free wi-fi and other perks. We didn't have to worry about the parking, because we took the Amtrak to New Orleans and caught a cab to the hotel. Like I said, everything we wanted to see was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kdegal
Reviews.Content: I love the Omni Royal Crescent. I have high expectations for where I decide to have my beauty rest after a long day of fun or business. Most people say " Oh its just a hotel, its not like you have to live there" but that's not the way I see it. Im more like if Im paying my good money to stay here it better be worth every dime even if im paying for a discounted package. This will be your home and place to unwind after a long flight, day out with family, or business meetings and you want to be able to relax and come HOME to a clean, comfortable, and quiet place. This hotel was all that and above. Rooms were clean, bathroom was spacious, clean, and up to date, beds were comfy and the staff were very nice.The only problems I did have was the shower in my room would not turn in different directions. It would only stay straight causing my shower to be a big mess since the water shot right through the curtain onto the floor. I didn't make a complaint because there was already a drain on the outside of the tub, which I thought was weird but obviously It was there for that purpose (to catch the water). So I figured they know about this problem and that was the solution. Also I asked for a computer room and they offered a small area behind the front desk. This was uncomfortable and I wasn't able to get anything done. Also I was not pleased with the valet parking area, it didn't seem safe and the area was not gated along with that it took forever for valet to arrive with our car. I would recommend this hotel and my sister and her family will be there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: JOLLYGOLIGHTLY
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in this hotel, and we keep returning for a reason...the staff is so friendly and helpful, the rooms are spotless and well-appointed, the restaurant is very good and also convenient, the location is excellent, and the service provided to Select Guest Members cannot be topped. We had an upgrade and a discount certificate, and we were upgraded to the Omni Suite on the top floor, which was even more of an upgrade than we booked. I have always loved the bathrooms at this hotel, and in the Omni Suite we had an extra half-bath. If you like thick, fluffy towels, luxurious robes, and excellent bathroom amenities like quality lotions and shampoos, then you'll love this place. Omni Hotels are special and inspire loyalty for a reason--they offer superior quality for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel in the CBD- Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BamaGriswolds
Reviews.Content: (Oct. 9-Oct. 11, 2009) When we are in New Orleans, we usually stay at the Omni Royal, but this trip we decided to try her sister hotel. The Crescent is adorned with art work, gilded mirrors, and beautiful marble floors. It's a grand scaled-down version of the magnificent Omni Royal. Our room was beautifully appointed, and the bed was SO comfortable. We enoyed our egg-themed breakfast at Dress It. The small fitness room had nice, clean equipment. The ONLY negative comment that I have is that the hotel seemed understaffed. I noticed this from our arrival. There was no one to direct us and valet our car. Parking was not an option in front of the hotel, so we had to make the block. Check-in was rather SLOW & my husband had to carry our luggage as there was no bellman. These aggrevations are not encountered at the Omni Royal, that's for sure. There was only one waitress at breakfast, and she seemed stretched thin. With all of that said, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Omni Royal Crescent. I offer my negative comments only as constructive criticism. I noticed that the manager takes the time to read and respond to TripAdvisor posts. I think that is great and shows that he cares greatly about his guests!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: the_miami_librarian
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I just spent our Honeymoon at the Omni Royal Orleans. this hotel was amazing. We got a great deal on the room by purchasing 21 days in advance. We also signed up as a select guest. This is a great deal. You get free internet, a free beverage in the morning and a few other perks. The staff was amazing and treated us like royalty. The concierge was very helpful and was able to answer any question we had. They sent us to great restaurants that were within our budgets. The room was an adequate size and the balcony was wonderful. We will go back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Post-Wedding Recovery”
Reviews.Author: retro_librarian
Reviews.Content: After a one hour drive from Baton Rouge, my husband and I were exhausted after our wedding. We were glad to have a nice, quiet room so we could recuperate from all of the joyous festivities of our wedding day. We were very please with our room. We stayed in one of the Jacuzzi suites. We mentioned that we were going to be on our honeymoon in the "comments" section when we booked online, and a complementary bottle of champagne was waiting for us upon arrival. Totally unexpected, but a very nice touch. The hotel is not very far from the French Quarter. It was, however, quite a long walk to get to the French Market, and places in that area. There is no breakfast included, like some hotels. We had breakfast in their restaurant once, and it was not very impressive. There was no swimming pool, but a roof top Jacuzzi. It was too hot for it in Louisiana in May, but it was a lovely view. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A splurge worth making”
Reviews.Author: perle0
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It's a fancier place than I normally stay in, but it was a good price and I felt like I got something for the extra money. The furnishings were nice, the bed was both elegant and comfy, and everything felt a notch above the ordinary. The bathroom in particular was luxurious--spacious and well appointed. The tub was very deep, perfect for a really good soak. The room was spacious, especially for downtown New Orleans, where rooms can be cramped. The location is about what you'd expect for downtown--parking is extra and has to be planned well in advance (you have to request your car a good half hour before you need it), but this is typical of all these downtown hotels. The burger restaurant in the hotel was a bit clueless, failing to interpret a "how late are you open" question as meaning "because I might want to order something," and nothing too out of the ordinary food-wise, but otherwise fine. In general I felt pampered and spoiled, and would go there again for an occasion worthy of such a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough for an Omni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moreland379
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night in New Orleans and quickly chose the Omni because we have stayed with Omni Hotels before and never had a problem. The room we had was very stuffy (the air conditioner was not functioning properly), and as soon as I sat on the bed the other end of it lifted up in the air. Upon checking under the bed it was being held up by makeshift wooden blocks, and this was unacceptable for me. Also I got a room with the jacuzzi tub, but when you want to take a shower the heads are not positioned properly and the water sprays everywhere into the bathroom thus causing me to slip and bang my knee into the hardware on the tub. All in all I was not happy with my stay, but if there is a plus it is the location, the friendly staff, and the workout room is nice. *UPDATE* All of our problems were brought to the attention of the management of this Omni hotel, and I am pleased to say that they have assured me that all of these issues have been resolved. They were very nice about it and I would now recommend this hotel to others. Enjoy your stay in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! More than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Msjunk212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to NOLA over Memorial Day Weekend and stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent. We found a great rate on the internet, and booked through the hotel's website. I arrived very early on Friday, expecting to check my bags and walk around for a few hours, but our room was ready and they were more than willing to let me in! EVERYONE we encountered at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. We got lots of great tips on restaurants and other attractions...at all hours of the day, every day! Our room had every ammenity we needed, and was spacious and clean! I loved the huge all marble bathroom and the bed and linens were perfectly crisp and comfy. The location is perfect. Close enough to walk everywhere you want to go, but far enough away from the big party. We were more than happy with our stay, we would recommend the Omni Royal Crescent to ANYONE, and we will defintely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: ecjohnso
Reviews.Content: The night we checked in, I tried to connect to the wireless internet but was not able to access it. I called the tech support line (from the bathroom, since the portable phone in the room was dead) but the operator was not able to diagnose my problem, and suggested that I uninstall and reinstall my wireless card (which I did not do and it worked fine the next day). Lots of street noise and door slamming at night. Also, we found someone's g-string under the tv stand (the staff removed this for us and offered us a coupon for a free coffee). I wished the restaurant offered a more extensive menu - I didn't think the burgers were very good at all. However, there are other places to eat within walking distance. All in all, the hotel is fine but not great, and definitely overpriced at 159-179/night. I think someone looking for a nice place to stay could do much better. Next time I am in New Orleans, I will pay the extra $ and stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: ILParrothead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 3 night stay. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and answered all of our questions. The valet service was very quick. The location is great...close to everything, but far enough from the Quarter and Canal to get a good night sleep. I strongly recommend this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raymonk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Royal Crescent on March 15th for 3 nights. We have traveled to New Orleanns several times in the last 7 months , as our daughter attends college there, and have tried different hotels each time trying to find the perfect one. The Royal Crescent did it for us. Check in was incredibly fast, and we were shown to a room within minutes of walking through the front door. This despite the fact we arrived at the hotel hours before checkin. The woman who checked us in was extremely friendly and stayed so each time we saw her. I wish I was sure of her name ...I think it was Arika Reed but am not sure. She was great. Called after we had been in the rooom for a few mintues to be sure all was OK. The room was great. We had requested a room with two double beds. The room we were given had 2 king beds, a large marble bathroom with jacuzzi tub and a 2nd marble bathroom wtih a glass shower. We had a nice flatscreen TV, plenty of extra large, thick bath towels, great bathrobes and really nice bath products. There was an abundance of hot water whenever we needed it and we took advantage of the jacuzzi tub. The room was spotless and was cleaned beautifully each day. How clean a room is is very important to me...this room was squeaky clean and seemed recently updated. The beds were comfortable and the bed linens were of good quality. The rooms are not huge, but cozy and with everything you need to be extremely comfotable. I loved the high ceilings in the rooms. We used the roman style hot tub on the 6th floor patio one day and it was very nice and relaxing. We had it to ourselves on a drizzly, cool afternoon and it was beautiful out there..nice plants and a fountain. Loved it. Did not use any of the fitness equipment. Did not try the on site restaurant, which is a gourmet burger joint called Dress It, but it smelled wonderful in there and we will check it out on our next trip. We did have room service bring us a pot of coffee and cream one morning. We were not charged for this which was a nice surprise...I think because we had signed up for the Omni select guest program, which is free, This also provided us with free wireless which worked well. We loved the location in the warehouse/arts district. It is only a few mins walk to the french quarter, and we spent alot of time there, but we also spent alot of time exploring the area and eateries around the hotel....there is a cool vibe in this area and I really loved it. Lastly, the people who work at the hotel were all friendly and efficient. The service was that of a 5 star hotel. I look forward t our next trip and a chance to stay at the Royal Crescent again. Kudos to the hotel for getting it all right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chunthebun
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Omni Royal Crescent. It's located just a block or so off Canal Street, which makes it very convenient to the French Quarter, as well to the Warehouse District and its great restaurants, the casino, the convention center, and the streetcars. The king room we had was quite luxurious, with a wonderfully comfortable bed and full marble bath. Staff was friendly and welcoming. A couple of negatives: one day, we did not have room service until after 5:00--and we had to ask the chambermaid to clean the room. But that might have been an unexpected staffing problem or something beyond one's control. I was not too impressed with the breakfast in the restaurant (typically overpriced continental breakfast). I did not have any other meals there, as it was always empty and dining well is one of the reasons one goes to NO. This was an elegant, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, elegant lobby”
Reviews.Author: sexykitten7
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the bed and pillows comfy. Large plasma tv with plenty of stations. Big bathroom, shower only. Hot water very limited and took over 5mins to warm up. Not sure if it was because the hotel was full or if this is normal. Location was nice as we were there the Sunday before Fat Tuesday, so it was 2 blocks away from Canal St. and not as noisey. Still close to everything. Went for breakfast in the morning and was a little disappointed in the buffet and my friend was not pleased with their made to order egg sandwhich. Would not eat there again but it was convinent for us as we were waiting for our airport shuttle. Staff in lobby and resturant were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ybgdess
Reviews.Content: I thought the Omni was a wonderful hotel! It was very clean and the staff was accomodating and nice. We were a little worried at first when we couldn't figure out where to park, but we just pulled to the side of the street and went in to ask. Check-in was a breeze and again, the front desk staff was very nice. Yes, the rooms are a tad small, but why are you spending a lot of time in your room?? The bed was extremely comfortable and I loved how clean everything was. Cleanliness is one of the most important things for me - I want to feel like I can walk around barefoot in the room and not get grossed out. This hotel definitely passed the test. We did not try to use the downstairs restaurant so I can't comment on the food. I loved the turn-down service they offered - when we got home from Bourbon street, the lights were turned low, the sheets turned down and a chocolate on the pillow. Nice touch! My only complaint is that the water temperature in the shower was only luke-warm - I mean, it barely got warm. So that was disappointing, but I didn't bother to mention it because what difference would it have made since we were only staying one night? We called around 3:30 a.m. and asked for a late checkout, which we recieved. Then when we checked out we wanted to go get something to eat and the front desk was very accomodating on keeping our luggage and holding onto the car for us until we got back. The hotel is within walking distance of everything you would want to do - the Superdome and the French Quarter. There is no need to use your car once you get to the hotel. However, you are far enough off the beaten track that you don't hear outside noise! The doors/walls were a tad thin and in the morning I could hear people talking in the halls and outside our window. But it is not located on a "party" street so you won't be kept up all night by any noise. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: anonymousreviewer10
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were billing itself as the equivalent of a Hampton Inn or Quality or something similar, I would give it a good rating. However, this property has no business selling itself as a luxury hotel. The location is great, let's say that. It's on quiet side street across from the Swedish embassy (yes, really). It's a block from the St. Charles streetcar, two blocks from Canal and right off Magazine St. It's a quick walk to the French Quarter or Riverwalk. The building itself is a lovely older structure. The room was impeccably clean, but tiny. The decor was nice enough, but unremarkable. It wasn't luxury by any means, nor was it up to the standards of, say, Loews. It was about what one would find at the Marriott or a nicer Comfort Inn. The health club is a lot worse than what one would find at the Marriott, too. It's almost impossible to find, hidden away behind a door at the end of a hallway on the sixth floor at the end of the rooftop deck. It's advertised as being 24 hours, but when I visited at 5 at night, it was completely dark and desolate--not an attendant anywhere in sight; not even a light on. It didn't seem like a safe place to be alone. Considering they had a grand total of FOUR machines, I guess it wasn't much of a loss. Oh, and that pretty pool, which looks so nice on the hotel's website? It's the width of a single lap lane and about eight feet long. I suppose if you had children you could let them wade but I'm not sure how they can claim this as an actual pool. Then we get to the part where Omni acted like a real low-budget operation: when the clerk attempted to bill my credit card for $125 more than the cost of my stay. When I asked what was going on and the credit card company kicked it back, I was told it was a credit for "incidentals" that might be run up in the hotel. The charge was NEVER mentioned to me beforehand--not during the booking process, not on Omni's confirmation email to me, not when I was standing in front of the clerk in the lobby, and not on the itemized invoice that I had signed. They also claimed the charge was $50/night...I'm not sure how that worked out to $125 for two nights, but maybe I'm the one with the fuzzy math. I guess Omni just decided to run a random unauthorized charge and then expected me not to notice? I've stayed in hotels all over the world, including some very exclusive properties, and nobody has ever done anything similar. The clerk claimed that "any hotel in New Orleans" would levy the same charges, which simply isn't true. When I mentioned that I'd stayed in the city before, including the Pontchartrain (my NO hotel of choice before it closed), he insisted I must have paid cash at the other hotels. When I told him I had not, he quickly amended his statement to say "it's an Omni policy." If this is truly the case, and it was not simply blatant discrimination on the part of the clerks against a guest who did not appear to be "upscale," then Omni needs to actually MENTION IT at some point during the booking process or check-in. It sort of boggles the mind that they itemized the .75 cents for newspaper delivery and somehow forgot this one. I made it clear to the clerks I would not authorize anything above or beyond the cost of my room, and I finally settled the matter, but it left a bad taste in my mouth. I think I could have stayed at the Holiday Inn and had a comparable time. And wow, do I miss the Pontchartrain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: InQueens26
Reviews.Content: I wa ssharing this room with two female coworkers (I am male) since we were going on business and wanted to extend our stay a few days. We were extremely pleased when we walked in the room to find out we actually had a suite. I did not book a suite, and nor did i expect this, I am not sure if all the rooms are like this or just some. We had our own rooms, i had abathroom with jacuzzi hot tub. The girls ahd their own bathroom with stand up shower. There was only one flat screen tv but that was ok. It was spacious, clean, big and clean. The bathroom was nice too. It was marble with gold trim. The beds were not full, not queens, but two KING beds! Tons of pillows. AC worked great. There was a nice clean gym. The pool was really a big hot tub outdoor. The only thing was that we didnt have a view, our room was in the middle and therefore it was kinda like a cave with no sunlight, we had a big window to the hallway which i thought was strange, but overall it was nice, trust me you dont want a room with a view in New Orleans. We got free continental breakfast. It was near the French Quarter. I would defiantely stay there again. It was safe also, you need your room key to get in which was good, i have stayed in other hotels where bums walk in and out of the hotel. The area is a little shady, but its new orleans, its going to be shady no matter where you go.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: rivoli_8
Reviews.Content: If you need a relatively comfortable place on vacation to tour the French Quarter, this would be a decent choice. Party is non-stop. I think about 10 or 20 years ago, this hotel would be a great choice. But if you are in New Orleans and need to get some work done, stay elsewhere (the W, the Hampton Inn are both better choices). Omni's physical facilities are nice--rooms are spacious, comfortable and the bathrooms are large and nice. Most of the staff is really nice and go out of their way. However, a lot of amenities that you might expect if you travel on business aren't there. No restaurant. No room service if you arrive back from work late and don't want to brave the French Quarter that late. No soda machines. Had to ask for mini-bar key. Maid took robes from the room after the first day (where'd they go?? LOL I don't think this is completely a Katrina issue). Wireless internet stopped working for my Macbook, after 1/2 hour on the phone with their IT hotline no help. No hard-wire substitute Internet available (if you need to get work done, this becomes a real problem). I kept being told the Internet was working (it wasn't working for everyone the way their router was configured), ironically while I was checking out I overheard the desk clerk telling the same thing to another frustrated guest (clue: if your guests are telling you it's not working, it's not working). Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Omni a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texasbeach1
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about this hotel after I booked it. I read some negative reviews before going. I was totally surprised by this place. It was beautiful. The people were extremely helpful and very nice. The room was huge and very nicely decorated. I can't say enough about the comfortable beds...heavenly! The most important thing it was very, very clean. Will most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni Royal Crescent”
Reviews.Author: abby152
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rate with the best service I have ever encountered. Location could not be better for touring the Frech Quarter...we were able to walk to all resturants with in 5-15 minutes. Did not have to drive for 2 days. Room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Highly recommended. $30/ day parking extra but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room with a view of a brick wall”
Reviews.Author: kgrejgeiprjerj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 4 nights while attending a conference. My jacuzzi room was tiny with a bed, dresser and TV. There was not enough space for a desk or chair. The floor to ceiling window faced about 3 feet of dead air space and then a brick wall. I was on the first floor and never saw sun light. The tv remote was missing as was the hair drier. The "pool" was a dirty hot tub with no jets. The resturant was closed for renovation. The hotel was quiet during the week, but on Friday nights the drunks came singing through the halls every few hours. When I complained to the front desk about the noise, I was brushed off. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF EXCELLENT, HOTEL FACTS WRONG!”
Reviews.Author: butchiemoleed
Reviews.Content: First of all Hotwire describes this hotel as having a pool - NOT! It has a very dirty oversized hot tub on the sixth floor. Hotwire says it has a restaurant - NOT! It has a space with tables and chairs for a restaurant, but only offers a continental breakfast - with no utensils available, cereal but only chocolate milk, day old pastry and no service person. We had no air conditioning the day before we left, was finally fixed by bedtime - given it was a Sunday, some consideration, but were told by manager that we could have a 10% discount on return trip - like that would happen. Hotwire does not advertise that it is a non-smoking hotel. Surprise! In the hotels defense, the rooms are small but clean, beds comfortable, quality sheets and down comforter. Towels were nice, but two for two people in hot weather was not enough - especially when the air went out. Hotel staff at front desk were some of the best we have encountered anywhere. One man appeared to have worked two shifts since we saw him in the evening and then again in the late morning. Still pleasant and helpful. Staff aside,we will not be back - not at $209 a night nor at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like Stuart Little!”
Reviews.Author: sillysully
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in NOLA and unfortunately stayed at the Omni RC. I used the bathroom at 5 am only to find a mouse frantically running loops around it trying to get out. I began yelling to my husband while putting my feet up on the toilet. He banged on the bathroom door, scaring the little guy, so I could escape to the bedroom. We figured we would call housekeeping at a more reasonable hour to have them take care of it. Well, DH has to use bathroom, so we decide to try to get mouse out of room ourselves. By now he was hidden in rolled towels that are in a basket on floor. Shake him out, hold bathroom and room door open - well, he decides it's too bright in hallway and scurries back under room door and ends up climbing the drapes. Call front desk to tell them situation; guy comes up w/sweeper thinking we meant dead mouse. He told us he would have mgr call when he got in at 7 am. Of course, I cannot get back to sleep, diligently watching floor, see mouse exit room into hallway. 7 am comes and goes, no call from mgr. We called front desk at 8:30, told manager is busy. 9 am - hear from mgr, tell him situation (man w/sweeper must never have shared info) and he offers to move us, but it won't be for a few hours. Finally, after much discussion between DH and I, we decide to stay in this room (only had one more night) figuring mouse could be in any room at this point and where's there's one, well, you know, there's probably a pretty large contingent of them. We ask them to just please really, really clean room, especially bathroom where contained, freaked mouse left droppings. We left and upon returning found droppings still on bathroom floor. Now, droppings were not numerous, but we knew they were there and we knew housekeeping did not sweep or wash floor. We went back down, spoke to manager, who was pleasant and did apologize and said he would see to it that housekeeping would take care of it. Left again, and returned only to find dirty bathroom floor still. I ended up cleaning it myself w/towel - yuck!!! My big issue - manager never checked back in with us and did nothing to compensate us for problems. Also, upon checkout, no apologies, nothing from desk clerk - our situation should have been noted on our ressie! We did not make a big stink, tried to take it all in stride, but in hindsight, maybe we should have been a little less accomodating ourselves. I suspect mgmnt will post a response as they have other to other negative reviews. Looking forward to hearing from you now; however, you were given ample opportunity while we were "guests."

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: UMICHUsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights and I really like it. The bedroom was very modern and the bed very nice. The breakfast was very healthful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It”
Reviews.Author: lolaz&fadeintoblue
Reviews.Content: Don't worry about the mixed reviews, this is a great hotel. The good: Great location just outside of the quarter. Newly remodeled rooms. Huge Bathroom and bathtub. Friendly and attentive staff. The bad: No onsite parking. No onsite restaurant yet (coming soon) We were looking for a romantic weekend getaway and found it at the Omni Royal Crescent. The front desk manager Frank was there to greet us when we arrived early and went to ensure our room was ready himself. This gave us a chance to speak with Cheryl and get the lowdown on the local restaurants etc... Both Frank and Cheryl were incredibly friendly and helpful every time we passed through the lobby Our room was wonderfully quiet and the bed was so comfortable it was hard to leave. The spa tub was deep enough to swim in and everything was clean and fresh. I also want to mention the young lady that works the front desk at night. Unfortunately I can't remember her name. When we called down at near midnight to get a resommendation on food delivery she actually brought some menus up to our room and made suggestions. Now that is service. The only 2 negative experiences were the parking that cost more than the rental car and a fourth desk clerk who obviously hates dealing with people and was openly hostile to hotel guests us included. I won't name her openly and I'm sure the staffing will work itself out as everyone else was so nice. In short I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jelaurenzi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Onmi Berkshire in Manhattan this spring, and was very excited to stay at another Omni. My room was quite pretty, with large windows, and was booked for only $89 at the hotel website. The front desk was friendly at check-in, and provided me with a city map marked with suggested walking routes on my first afternoon. However, on the first morning, beverage service was late and was only provided for 1 person, not the 2 requested. The cup of coffee was accompanied by packets of non-dairy creamer and sweeteners. I went downstairs and got another coffee from the continental breakfast, and took a milk for the coffees. (The breakfast was more attractive than most, with fruits and cheeses and petits-fours, along with the typical cereals and breads.) When we came in on the second evening, about 9 pm, I wanted to stop at the desk to get a beverage card for the next morning, but no employee was present in the lobby or behind the desk. We called out "hello" a few times, but got no response. We decided to call down from our room phone, but our keys would not work. Back downstairs, and still no employees. We called the hotel on our cell phone, and on about the 15th ring, 2 people emerged. There was no apology or explanation for the inconvenience, but the employees were still friendly. Our keys were reset and we got a beverage card. Beverage service the 2nd morning was at the time requested, made for 2 people, and they included liquid cream and creamer. (I wrote a request on our beverage card). I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, and if I hadn't had such a wonderful experience at the Berkshire, I wouldn't stay at another Omni.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, but nothing special !”
Reviews.Author: queeni814
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2007. When we booked, hotel web site had not been updated- all pictures were pre- Katrina ! It did not look like that when we arrived ! I know they are trying to remodel. Room was a bit small but adequate. Bathroom was weird- shower door only covered half the bathtub- so water went all over floor !! Hotel staff was very friendly & helpful . We felt pretty safe walking- not too far from Canal Street. You do better getting advice from the local people on eating places - We loved Deanie's- good food & good price ! All in all I would pay more for a hotel that had better aminites.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this location on June 23, 2005 for three nights. The hotel's staff were helpful. I made one complaint. I needed clean towels that morning. I waited for about an hour, and still no towels. On my way out for my morning outing, I let the staff know that I still did not receive any clean towels and that I had to use the ones from the previous night. I was not happy with that. But, one staff apologized for the inconvience and promise to get them for me by the time I returned. When I retuned, there were clean towels awaiting. The hotel is in a great location; away from the noise, but close enough to the French Quarters. Everything is in walking distance. This hotel is a little outdated and needs to be renovated, but it still was a comfortable place to stay for the price. Yes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the value, service was friendly but not accurate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent value that we got through Travelocity. Was worried about the equal number of good and bad comments when reviewing trip advisor! The value was EXCELLENT. If you are a service snob and want no lateness or forgetfulness of requests, then you will be disappointed. They always apologized nicely but forgot one wake up call in the afternoon and often forgot the beverage requests in the morning. The room was kept very clean and a note was hand written by the maid for the tips left. The hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Omni Royal”
Reviews.Author: Hope2CItAll
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very quiet and the staff was friendly. Location was very good. 2 blocks from the French Quarter, Streetcar, and Harrahs. Rooms were a little on the small side. The pool is not much more that a soaking tub. But there is a hot tub and very nice roof top patio. I would stay here again.
